description.text:
Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

We currently have a diverse global team of 700 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are Activism, Transparency, Dedication and Greatness and Collective. We are proud to be a BCorp.

About The Role 🖥️
Based in our Parisian office and reporting to the Director of HRBP Manager, you will join a team of five HR Business Partners, all fully dedicated to developing Vestiaire Collective on a global scale.

As an HRBP, your role will be to:

Collaborate with managers and department heads to align HR initiatives with business objectives

Support managers in managing complex employee relations and resolving conflicts

Develop and implement initiatives aimed at improving employee engagement and talent retention

What You Will Do 👜

Organizational Development Oversee the organizational development of Marketing and Commercial teams Ensure the application of our global HR strategy and policies, while respecting operational requirements Collaborate with other People Partners (Learning & Development, Legal, Talent) to build, continuously improve, and deploy processes related to the employee experience



Be a true partner to your teams

 Drive change management to support employees and managers in implementing new initiatives Support team performance and achievement of objectives by providing HR expertise and ensuring compliance with legal and contractual rules Monitor workplace climate, actively identify early warning signs, and maintain a regular on-site presence Maintain contact and collaborate with occupational health services to ensure individual employee follow-up



Team Development

 Support managers during performance reviews or sensitive situations Help leaders develop and strengthen their skills Conduct annual salary and compensation reviews, ensuring equality and equity Contribute to the annual performance review process, ensuring it remains dynamic and adapted to the company’s evolution



Who You Are ⭐

Full proficiency in English, French is not required but considered a bonusYou thrive in a dynamic, results-oriented environmentYou genuinely enjoy helping others and have a strong interest in peopleExcellent IT skills, particularly in Excel and HRISSolution-oriented with strong analytical skillsDirect communication and influencing abilitiesFoundational understanding of HR payroll and legal processesSelf-starter with initiative; ideally 3+ years of HR experience to succeed in this role(Bonus) Experience working with marketing and commercial teams



What we offer 🎁

A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability

The opportunity to do career-defining work in a fast-growing French-born scale up

The possibility to work as part of a globally diverse team with more than 50 nationalities

Two days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association

Significant investment in your learning and growth

Competitive Compensation And Benefits Package
As full member of our entrepreneurial project, you will be eligible to free shares

Research indicates that people from underrepresented backgrounds—including women, people with disabilities, and other marginalized communities—often hesitate to apply for roles unless they meet every single requirement.

At Vestiaire Collective, we believe that talent comes in many forms, and we're committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. Your unique perspective could be exactly what our team needs, so we encourage you to apply even if you don't tick every box.

Vestiaire Collective is an equal opportunities employer 
Beware of Scams
Vestiaire Collective only contacts candidates via official emails ending in @vestiairecollective.com or no-reply@hire.lever.co . We never use WhatsApp, Telegram, or similar apps for job offers, nor will we ever request payments or banking details.

If you receive a suspicious message, please report it to talentacquisition@vestiairecollective.com

description.text:
ABOUT BEDROCKBedrock is a media-tech venture, formed as a JV between M6 and RTL Group (part of Bertelsmann). The company is the trusted strategic streaming partner of leading entertainment companies in Europe, operating their full streaming services and delivering state-of-the-art experience to their audiences.With 15+ years of streaming expertise and 450 skilled professionals in 10 countries, Bedrock has become the premier strategic streaming platform in Europe.At Bedrock, we love challenges, whether they're related to features, scaling, performance or peak traffic. We believe that learning new tricks is a journey and sharing them with peers is definitely part of the fun.

Bedrock is looking for a Product Manager with a strong background in Product Management (3+ years) to join our team and contribute to the product strategy, roadmap, and implementation of our platform's advertising monetization capabilities.
You'll be instrumental in the design and delivery of solutions that enable broadcasters and media companies to optimize their advertising revenue and enhance the user ad experience.
This is an exciting opportunity for someone who thrives on turning complex problems into impactful solutions, and who is curious about the Advertising ecosystem (display, video, audio, programmatic, etc.).While prior experience in advertising tech (Ad Servers, SSPs, DSPs…) is a plus what matters is your solid experience in Product Management and your interest in the Ads domain.
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
This role offers significant learning opportunities as you help define flexible, scalable solutions supporting diverse ad formats and targeting strategies. You'll operate within a dynamic and evolving ecosystem, ensuring our platform effectively integrates with key third-party advertising systems and addresses our clients' specific business challenges, ultimately reinforcing their trust in our solutions.
As a Product Manager, you will :
Drive Product Strategy: Contribute to the development of our Ads monetization roadmap and help align it with business goals and client needs to maximize advertising revenue.
Build impactful Ad Products: Support the product discovery process and feature delivery within the advertising domain. Contribute to the design and delivery of flexible, configurable tools that allow clients to effectively manage their ad inventories, formats, and targeting strategies.
Assist with Ad Ecosystem & Integration Strategy: Participate in defining and streamlining the platform's integration strategy with Ad Servers, programmatic platforms (SSPs, DSPs), and other ad technologies used by our clients. Help ensure robust connectivity and leverage ecosystem capabilities.
Represent Client & User Needs -Advertising-: Contribute to translating broadcasters' ad monetization strategies into scalable and reliable product features. Help promote solutions that balance platform consistency with necessary customization and configurability. Ensure a high-quality, non-intrusive user ad experience.
Leverage data : Work closely with Data Science/BI teams to define advertising KPIs, analyze platform and client data (e.g., fill rates, click-through rates, RPMs) to derive actionable insights. Participate in defining, prioritizing, and analyzing experiments (A/B tests) to validate hypotheses and optimize ad performance.
Collaborate across teams  Partner with Engineering, UX/UI, Data, Architecture, and Go-To-Market to ensure smooth execution from discovery to deployment. 


WHAT WE’ RE LOOKING FOR
3+ years of experience as a Product Manager, ideally in a B2B SaaS/PaaS environmentStrong ownership mindset, capable of managing products from idea to launch and beyond
Curiosity about Ads monetization models and advertising technology — experience in the field is a plus, but not a must
Analytical skills and a data-informed approach to decision-making
Ability to communicate clearly and collaborate with both technical and non-technical teamsand to influence cross-functional teams and build consensus
A proactive, structured, and adaptable working style
Excellent communication and presentation skills : Ability to clearly articulate complex concepts, strategies, and trade-offs to diverse audiences, including executives, technical teams, and clients. 

Beyond technical skills, we are looking for talents with:
Excellent team player who fosters collaborationAbility to adapt to changing environments and challengesStrong focus on client satisfaction and delivering high-quality serviceInnovative mindset with a passion for continuous improvementFluent in English
LIFE AT BEDROCKYou'll join an enthusiastic, friendly and close-knit team in a fast-growing tech company with more than 10 years' experience and a strong network of media shareholders.Work flexibility and brand-new office spaces with a great location.A top-notch tech expertise : documentation, support, R&D, management seniority…Work Evolutions & opportunities within the company, as well as training.Strong human connections knowledge sharing: Last Friday Talks, Demos, Meet-Ups, HR Roadshows

description.text:
Job Opportunity: Marketing Director – Global Pharma (Life Sciences)
Sector: Life Sciences | Specialization: Pharmaceutical Manufacturing / Contamination ControlAre you a strategic marketing leader with a passion for innovation in the pharmaceutical industry?
An established global player in the Life Sciences sector is seeking a Marketing Director – Global Pharma to lead its international marketing strategy for contamination control solutions in pharmaceutical manufacturing environments.
This is a high-impact leadership role, perfect for a results-driven professional who thrives at the intersection of strategy, innovation, and execution. You'll shape global go-to-market strategies, oversee portfolio development, and lead a high-performing team across key regions.
What You’ll Do:As Marketing Director – Global Pharma, you will:🌍 Strategic LeadershipDevelop and execute long-term marketing strategies for the global pharmaceutical segment in alignment with executive leadership.Define customer segmentation, market positioning, and competitive differentiation.Identify inorganic growth opportunities (e.g., partnerships, M&A) to support market expansion.🧪 Portfolio & Innovation ManagementOversee the global portfolio of contamination control solutions for pharmaceutical manufacturers.Drive the innovation pipeline in collaboration with R&D, Regulatory, and Technical teams.Manage the full product lifecycle, including global launches, phase-ins/outs, and updates driven by compliance.🚀 Commercial ActivationCollaborate with Sales, Regional Marketing, and Communications teams to drive brand awareness and lead generation through effective campaigns and customer engagement strategies.Ensure a consistent value proposition and aligned messaging across all markets.📊 Customer & Market InsightMaintain deep knowledge of customer workflows, market dynamics, and the competitive landscape.Lead market research and customer insight initiatives.Build strategic relationships with key opinion leaders (KOLs) and support thought leadership efforts.👥 Team LeadershipLead and develop a global team of 8+ marketers, fostering a culture of collaboration, accountability, and innovation.Provide mentorship and drive cross-functional alignment between Portfolio, Commercial, and Segment teams.What You BringAdvanced degree (MBA or MSc in Marketing, Chemistry, Microbiology, or related field).10+ years of experience in the pharmaceutical or life sciences manufacturing industry.8+ years in marketing or related leadership roles, with proven success in global B2B environments.Experience managing large, diverse, and international teams.Ability to turn complex strategy into clear, actionable plans with measurable outcomes.Strong commercial acumen, with a track record of leading successful product launches and market expansions.Outstanding communication, analytical, and cross-functional collaboration skills.Comfortable in a dynamic, fast-paced environment with a strong sense of ownership and urgency.
Why Join?Shape global strategy in a critical growth area of the life sciences industry.Join a mission-driven organization focused on supporting safe medicines and cleaner production environments.Work in a collaborative environment with strong support from sales, technical, and digital teams across multiple global hubs.Make a measurable impact on a rapidly growing segment and develop your leadership career on an international stage.
Ready to lead the future of pharma marketing on a global scale?
Apply now to take the next bold step in your career.
All applications will be handled in strict confidence.

Chemistry, Microbiology, or related field).10+ years of experience in the pharmaceutical or life sciences manufacturing industry.8+ years in marketing or related leadership roles, with proven success in global B2B environments.Experience managing large, diverse, and international teams.Ability to turn complex strategy into clear, actionable plans with measurable outcomes.Strong commercial acumen, with a track record of leading successful product launches and market expansions.Outstanding communication, analytical, and cross-functional collaboration skills.Comfortable in a dynamic, fast-paced environment with a strong sense of ownership and urgency.
Why Join?Shape global strategy in a critical growth area of the life sciences industry.Join a mission-driven organization focused on supporting safe medicines and cleaner production environments.Work in a collaborative environment with strong support from sales, technical, and digital teams across multiple global hubs.Make a measurable impact on a rapidly growing segment and develop your leadership career on an international stage.
Ready to lead the future of pharma marketing on a global scale?
Apply now to take the next bold step in your career.
All applications will be handled in strict confidence.

description.text:
NOUS RECRUTONS UN GROWTH DIRECTOR

TLC Worldwide est la première plateforme mondiale de récompenses, aidant les plus grandes marques à se connecter avec leurs clients à travers des expériences plutôt que des réductions. Fondée à Londres en 1991, notre entreprise s’est développée pour compter 14 hubs à travers le monde, utilisant notre système COSMOS™ Insights pour proposer à chaque consommateur des expériences parfaitement adaptées.

Nous célébrons nos réussites ensemble, valorisons l'innovation, la responsabilité, et mettons l'accent sur la création de valeur pour nos parties prenantes grâce à une communication honnête et le souci du détail. Nous partageons tous un esprit de croissance et l’ambition d’améliorer constamment notre technologie et nos données, pour offrir à nos clients des analyses et des insights toujours plus puissants, pilotés par l’IA.

Nous croyons au pouvoir de la collaboration en personne tout en offrant la flexibilité nécessaire pour maintenir un bon équilibre vie pro / vie perso.

Si vous vous épanouissez dans un environnement dynamique où chaque idée compte, TLC Worldwide est faite pour vous !

Ce que nous offrons :

Un environnement créatif porté par une équipe dynamique et collaborative, offrant une interaction avec des clients et collègues internationauxDes webinaires hebdomadaires pour soutenir votre développement via notre People AcademyLa Semaine du Bien-être annuelle chez TLC et des programmes tout au long de l’annéeLe TLC Culture Club – avec des événements sociaux saisonniers, déjeuners gourmands & plus encoreTLC Gives Back – des opportunités de bénévolat, y compris des visites sur site et des jours de congé pour actions solidairesTLC Rise – soutenir et encourager les femmes à accéder à des postes de directionLes "Frankies" – notre propre cérémonie de remise de prix avec tapis rouge TLC et tenues d’apparatTLC Owner’s Club – chaque membre de l’aventure TLC contribue à notre succès, c’est pourquoi chacun possède une part de l’entreprise via notre programme d’actionnariat

Vos missions :

Inspirer et guider les clients pour développer de nouveaux programmes à long terme et sur plusieurs annéesÉlaborer et mettre en œuvre des stratégies de vente innovantes pour stimuler la croissance dans des secteurs spécifiquesIdentifier et conclure des opportunités commerciales majeuresUtiliser les données pour formuler des solutions gagnantes pour les clientsCollaborer avec toutes les équipes de TLC pour garantir une exécution fluide et le succès client

Profil recherché :

Esprit d’équipe dynamique et collaboratifExpérience confirmée dans la conclusion d’accords – croissance significative et contrats longue durée à la cléCapacité à inspirer et encourager les autres à penser grandPensée stratégique exceptionnelle avec l’aptitude à transformer une vision en actions concrètes pour construire un pipeline de ventes solideEsprit d’initiative, énergie débordante et passion pour les résultats

Pourquoi vous allez adorer travailler avec nous :

Nous ne sommes pas une entreprise de promotions comme les autres – nous sommes un acteur clé dans la création de campagnes de fidélisation, d’engagement et d’acquisition pour les plus grandes marques du monde. Vous aurez la liberté d’innover, le soutien pour réussir, et des récompenses pour chaque succès.

Poste à fort impact où vous serez en première ligne pour développer des opportunités avec les plus grandes marquesValorisation de vos compétences dans des secteurs que vous maîtrisezSalaire compétitif + énorme bonus sur performancesEnvironnement collaboratif et dynamique – les victoires sont collectives et toujours célébréesExcellentes opportunités d’apprentissage et de développement

En tant qu’entreprise axée sur l’humain, nous recrutons selon des valeurs et croyons que nos collaborateurs sont la clé de notre culture unique.

Chez TLC, nous aspirons à créer un « monde dans le monde », exempt de préjugés, de biais et d’inégalités.

Un monde où la diversité est valorisée et célébrée, et où nous nous efforçons de garantir à chacun les mêmes chances de réussite.

Si tout cela vous enthousiasme, il est temps de postuler !

basic_info.title: CDI - Group Performance & Talent Manager - H/F/X

description.text:
Job description:

The role : Permanent contract to be filled as soon as possible. Based in Paris 17th.As the Global Performance & Talent Manager, you will be responsible for leading and optimizing the HR cycle related to performance and talent development, ensuring alignment with the company’s strategic ambitions. Your role will contribute to fostering a culture of development and engagement at Clarins by developing innovative programs that position Clarins as a Great Place to Grow. What you’ll do : 1. Management of the HR Cycle on Performance, Talent, and Development (40%) Ensure the coherence and effectiveness of the HR cycle, making sure it reflects the strategic ambitions of the organization. Anticipate and monitor necessary developments to maintain the relevance of the cycle. Manage and support the annual performance review campaign. Operate the HR cycle effectively:  Prepare performance and development campaign materials. Facilitate campaign activities (meetings, workshops, etc.) Train and support HR teams  Develop and track reporting related to performance and talent metrics  2. Development and Facilitation of Talent Development Programs (30%) Participate in the design of innovative talent development programs aligned with the HR strategy of the organization. Ensure the deployment of talent development programs for employees (as Mentoring or Coaching programs) Evaluate the effectiveness of development programs and recommend improvements. Support the Head of Talent in the Talent Review and succession planning processes.  3. Lead Projects that Position Clarins as a Great Place to Grow (30%) Actively participate in initiatives aimed at enhancing employee experience and strengthening team engagement. Lead global listening projects to gather employee insights (such as Your Say, the Clarins Employee engagement survey, conducted each 2 years) Collaborate with internal teams to promote a culture of growth and continuous development.  4. Analytics & Reports Develop and maintain Dashboards and reports on key talent and performance metrics. Provide insights and recommendations based on data trends  

Profile description:

 You are : An experienced project manager, able to lead complex initiatives involving multiple stakeholders while respecting tight deadlines. Comfortable with data, with strong analytical skills and proficiency in reporting tools. A confident communicator, skilled in facilitating group discussions and delivering impactful presentations. A true team player, capable of building strong cross-functional relationships in an international environment. Proactive and forward-thinking, with a strong sense of initiative and the ability to anticipate needs.  You have : A Bachelor's degree in HR, Psychology, Management or a related field. Minimum 5 years of experience in a similar position, ideally in an international context. Strong project management and organizational skills. Excellent command of English (written and spoken). Proficiency in data analysis and reporting tools.  Experience in the beauty, luxury, fashion or cosmetics sector is a plus.   

We offer:

We have : Close to 70 years of expertise in beauty and spa, with the Clarins and myBlend brands Unique products and innovative services A commitment to Social & Environmental Responsibility embedded in our raison d'être A caring and inclusive corporate culture Development and training opportunities Attractive compensation and benefits A flexible work environment, with up to 2 days of remote working per week

description.text:
The Lab recrute un(e) Growth Partner de très haut niveau.
Pas un marketer.Pas un growth hacker.Un constructeur de cashflows, un killer avec une méthode.Un braqueur de marché, prêt à faire décoller des projets from zero to revenue.
🧭 Localisation obligatoire :Ce poste est basé à Montpellier, en présentiel dans nos bureaux chez The Lab Coworking.On veut un(e) coéquipier(e) sur le terrain, pas un remote vague.
🎮 Le jeu
Ici, le succès commence dans la tête.Tu ne viens pas pour “tester une idée”, tu viens faire du chiffre dès J1.Tu n’attends pas le produit : tu vends l’offre.Tu n’envoies pas 200 cold emails : tu en envoies 10 000.Tu ne prépares pas un pitch deck : tu prépares une machine à cash.Tu construis avec nous des boîtes lean, rentables, qui génèrent du revenu avant de lever.Tu analyses, tu testes, tu lances, tu ajustes. Rapidement. Sans ego.Tu es là pour bâtir des machines de vente, pas des musées de fonctionnalités.
💼 Ton rôle
Lancer des projets de zéro : construire l’offre, la tester, la vendre.Identifier les canaux d’acquisition à ROI immédiat (ads, cold, outbound…)Exécuter en priorité ce qui convertit (pas ce qui flatte l’ego produit)Travailler main dans la main avec le CTO et les fondateursT’assurer que chaque MVP trouve ses premiers clients rapidementPiloter les métriques critiques : LTV / CAC, RPM, Revenu / Download, Break-even
🧠 Ton profil
Tu as déjà fait du revenu avec rien (pas besoin d’un produit pour vendre)Tu sais closer en outbound, en call, en DM, en landingTu penses en effet composé, en funnels, en chiffre, pas en likesTu es obsédé par la vitesse, l’impact, le résultatTu connais les fondamentaux du growth moderne : payant, scraping, automation, GTM…Tu veux devenir associé de tes propres projets, pas juste prestataireEt surtout, tu es basé à Montpellier ou prêt à y travailler au quotidien avec l’équipe
🧩 Pourquoi toi + The Lab = combo
Tu vas bosser sur des projets où :
Le CTO est une machine à builderLe marketing est pris en charge par une team dédiéeLe Studio t’offre le legal, le design, le branding, le réseau d’investisseursTu peux lancer 3 à 4 produits par mois et scaler ceux qui fonctionnentLes projets sont pensés pour être déployés à l’international dès le départEt tout ça, depuis notre base d’opérations à The Lab, Montpellier
💰 Rémunération
% du chiffre d’affaires net généré dès J1 (pas d’attente, pas de bullshit)Equity sur les boîtes créées, si le MVP est validéBonus en cas de levéePossibilité de devenir cofondateur des projets les plus prometteurs
🛠 Mode opératoire
Tu travailles en autonomie, en lien direct avec les fondateurs.Pas de hiérarchie. Pas de bullshit. Juste des projets, une méthode, et du feu.
🤝 Ce qu’on attend de toi
Tu arrives avec ta méthode, ta rage et ta disciplineTu comprends que la meilleure idée est celle qui vendTu sais que l’exécution > inspirationTu veux monter un empire, pas faire un side-projectEt tu es physiquement dans l’arène avec nous, à Montpellier
Ready to play ?
Envoie-nous ton track record, ton canal préféré, et la dernière fois que tu as fait 10k€ avec un Notion + un Stripe.
👉 Rejoins l’unité spéciale de The Lab. Depuis Montpellier.

description.text:
Vos challenges :
Rattaché(e) à l'équipe Sales E-commerce, l’Assistant(e) Animation Commerciale participe à l’optimisation des animations commerciales pour le site e-shop. Dans ce cadre vous assurez les missions suivantes :
Paramétrage et coordination des opérations commerciales en France et à l’internationalReporting et analyse des performances quotidiennesAnalyses chiffrées des opérations commerciales & recommandations des best practices Préconisations d’optimisations UI/UX (parcours client, interface,…) Animation spécifique sur les versions internationales du site
Poste basé à Saint-Macaire-en-Mauges sur l'axe Nantes / Cholet à pourvoir en septembre en CDI.
Votre profil :
De formation commerciale/marketing digital (BAC+2/3), vous bénéficiez d'une expérience réussie idéalement dans la gestion opérationnelle d’un site d’e-commerce.
Vous avez une sensibilité mode, vous êtes organisé(e) et à l’aise avec l’outil informatique notamment le pack office et Google Analytics.

description.text:
Riche de 140 années d’histoire, Tarkett est un leader mondial des solutions innovantes de revêtements de sol et de surfaces sportives. Le Groupe a réalisé un chiffre d’affaires de 3,3 milliards d’euros en 2024.

Tarkett conçoit, fabrique et vend une large gamme de solutions intégrant des sols vinyles, linoléum, caoutchouc, moquettes, parquets et stratifiés, gazons synthétiques et pistes d’athlétisme auprès des hôpitaux, des écoles, de l’habitat, des hôtels, des bureaux ou commerces et des terrains de sport.

Avec près de 12 000 collaborateurs, 35 sites de production, 24 centres de R&D, 8 centres de recyclage, le Groupe sert ses clients dans plus de 100 pays dans le monde. 

Engagé dans une démarche d’économie circulaire et de réduction de son empreinte carbone, le Groupe met en place une stratégie d'éco-innovation inspirée des principes Cradle to Cradle®, alignée avec son approche Tarkett Human-Conscious Design®.

Au sein de l’équipe Communication Groupe et rattaché(e) à la Directrice Communication Groupe, nous recherchons notre futur(e) Responsable Communication (digitale & éditoriale) /  Digital & Editorial Communication Manager (F/H) en CDI, basé à La Défense.

Vos Missions :

En tant que Responsable Communication (digitale & éditoriale), vous piloterez et mettrez en œuvre des initiatives de communication à la fois au niveau Groupe et au niveau de la division EMEA. Vous jouerez un rôle clé dans le renforcement de la visibilité corporate de Tarkett, l’animation des communautés internes, et la mise en place d’expériences digitales de qualité à travers les canaux propriétaires du Groupe.

Pour cela, vous interviendrez sur les points suivants :

Développement de la stratégie digitale & éditoriale :Vous contribuerez au plan de communication annuel groupe, avec un focus particulier sur les stratégies éditoriales et digitales. Vous serez en charge de suivre et piloter votre budget (outils digitaux, prestataires externes, ...) mais également d’optimiser les coûts et les dépenses sur les différents sujets de communication.Vous participerez à l’élaboration du calendrier éditorial à travers l’intranet, le site web, les réseaux sociaux et la newsletter.

Communication digitale externe : Vous serez en charge d’activer la communication digitale externe : vous travaillerez la stratégie réseaux sociaux Tarkett afin d’en faire un levier stratégique pour le groupe et les divisions. Pour ce faire vous veillerez à la qualité, la pertinence et la régularité des contenus en lien avec les équipes locales. 

Communication digitale interne : Vous serez le référent fonctionnel et le garant de l’Intranet Groupe. Vous travaillerez avec les différents collaborateurs (IT, divisions, pays, usines, ...) sur les évolutions et améliorations.Vous piloterez l’animation éditoriale de l’intranet EMEA en identifiant les sujets clés, en proposant des formats engageants, ...
Vos Qualifications et Compétences :

Vous êtes titulaire d’un Bac+5 spécialisé en en communication et/ou médias digitaux. Vous justifiez d’une expérience de 8 ans minimum dans des fonctions similaires au sein d’un grand groupe international. Vous êtes bilingue anglais / français avec une excellente plume dans les deux langues.Vous maitrisez les plateformes digitales, les stratégies éditoriales et vous savez piloter des projets transverses complexes. Vous avez un excellent relationnel, vous aimez travailler en équipe et en transverse. Vous êtes dynamique, proactif(ve), orienté(e) solutions et vous disposez d’un leadership naturel vous permettant de mettre en avant vos projets de manière créative et pragmatique !Enfin, vous avez un fort esprit analytique vous permettant d’exploiter les données afin de travailler en amélioration continue.

Les avantages que nous offrons: 

Au-delà du salaire, nous offrons un ensemble d'avantages, dont un variable indexé sur la performance collective et individuelle, une prime d'intéressement, 2 jours de télétravail par semaine, 13 RTT, une couverture santé renforcée (Alan), une carte tickets restaurant, des remises collaborateurs sur des offres Tarkett, et d'autres encore qui vous seront commentés au fur et à mesure.

Process de recrutement: 

Premiers échanges, téléphonique puis présentiel, avec Sarah, équipe Talent AcquisitionTest d’anglais Entretien avec Marie, votre managerDernier échange avec Sanja, DRH du périmètre EMEA-LATAM

Retrouvez-nous sur: Welcome to the Jungle !

Tarkett recrute aux compétences et privilégie l’égalité des chances et la diversité au sein des équipes, notamment en faveur de l’égalité femmes-hommes, de la mixité sociale, du handicap et de l’intergénérationnel. 

By joining us, you will be part of an international culture where you can expand your horizons, change the game and design the future of society. And where our values of collaboration, creativity, commitment and caring underpin our success.

Come and see how is life at Tarkett!

https://careers.tarkett.com/en/home.html

jobs_analyzed.description:
Riche de 140 années d’histoire, Tarkett est un leader mondial des solutions innovantes de revêtements de sol et de surfaces sportives. Le Groupe a réalisé un chiffre d’affaires de 3,3 milliards d’euros en 2024.

Tarkett conçoit, fabrique et vend une large gamme de solutions intégrant des sols vinyles, linoléum, caoutchouc, moquettes, parquets et stratifiés, gazons synthétiques et pistes d’athlétisme auprès des hôpitaux, des écoles, de l’habitat, des hôtels, des bureaux ou commerces et des terrains de sport.

Avec près de 12 000 collaborateurs, 35 sites de production, 24 centres de R&D, 8 centres de recyclage, le Groupe sert ses clients dans plus de 100 pays dans le monde. 

Engagé dans une démarche d’économie circulaire et de réduction de son empreinte carbone, le Groupe met en place une stratégie d'éco-innovation inspirée des principes Cradle to Cradle®, alignée avec son approche Tarkett Human-Conscious Design®.

Au sein de l’équipe Communication Groupe et rattaché(e) à la Directrice Communication Groupe, nous recherchons notre futur(e) Responsable Communication (digitale & éditoriale) /  Digital & Editorial Communication Manager (F/H) en CDI, basé à La Défense.

Vos Missions :

En tant que Responsable Communication (digitale & éditoriale), vous piloterez et mettrez en œuvre des initiatives de communication à la fois au niveau Groupe et au niveau de la division EMEA. Vous jouerez un rôle clé dans le renforcement de la visibilité corporate de Tarkett, l’animation des communautés internes, et la mise en place d’expériences digitales de qualité à travers les canaux propriétaires du Groupe.

Pour cela, vous interviendrez sur les points suivants :

Développement de la stratégie digitale & éditoriale :Vous contribuerez au plan de communication annuel groupe, avec un focus particulier sur les stratégies éditoriales et digitales. Vous serez en charge de suivre et piloter votre budget (outils digitaux, prestataires externes, ...) mais également d’optimiser les coûts et les dépenses sur les différents sujets de communication.Vous participerez à l’élaboration du calendrier éditorial à travers l’intranet, le site web, les réseaux sociaux et la newsletter.

Communication digitale externe : Vous serez en charge d’activer la communication digitale externe : vous travaillerez la stratégie réseaux sociaux Tarkett afin d’en faire un levier stratégique pour le groupe et les divisions. Pour ce faire vous veillerez à la qualité, la pertinence et la régularité des contenus en lien avec les équipes locales. 

Communication digitale interne : Vous serez le référent fonctionnel et le garant de l’Intranet Groupe. Vous travaillerez avec les différents collaborateurs (IT, divisions, pays, usines, ...) sur les évolutions et améliorations.Vous piloterez l’animation éditoriale de l’intranet EMEA en identifiant les sujets clés, en proposant des formats engageants, ...
Vos Qualifications et Compétences :

Vous êtes titulaire d’un Bac+5 spécialisé en en communication et/ou médias digitaux. Vous justifiez d’une expérience de 8 ans minimum dans des fonctions similaires au sein d’un grand groupe international. Vous êtes bilingue anglais / français avec une excellente plume dans les deux langues.Vous maitrisez les plateformes digitales, les stratégies éditoriales et vous savez piloter des projets transverses complexes. Vous avez un excellent relationnel, vous aimez travailler en équipe et en transverse. Vous êtes dynamique, proactif(ve), orienté(e) solutions et vous disposez d’un leadership naturel vous permettant de mettre en avant vos projets de manière créative et pragmatique !Enfin, vous avez un fort esprit analytique vous permettant d’exploiter les données afin de travailler en amélioration continue.

Les avantages que nous offrons: 

Au-delà du salaire, nous offrons un ensemble d'avantages, dont un variable indexé sur la performance collective et individuelle, une prime d'intéressement, 2 jours de télétravail par semaine, 13 RTT, une couverture santé renforcée (Alan), une carte tickets restaurant, des remises collaborateurs sur des offres Tarkett, et d'autres encore qui vous seront commentés au fur et à mesure.

Process de recrutement: 

Premiers échanges, téléphonique puis présentiel, avec Sarah, équipe Talent AcquisitionTest d’anglais Entretien avec Marie, votre managerDernier échange avec Sanja, DRH du périmètre EMEA-LATAM

Tarkett recrute aux compétences et privilégie l’égalité des chances et la diversité au sein des équipes, notamment en faveur de l’égalité femmes-hommes, de la mixité sociale, du handicap et de l’intergénérationnel. 

By joining us, you will be part of an international culture where you can expand your horizons, change the game and design the future of society. And where our values of collaboration, creativity, commitment and caring underpin our success.

Come and see how is life at Tarkett!

basic_info.title: Chef de projet marketing Crédit immobilier et Assurance Des Emprunteurs F/H

description.text:
Description de l'entreprise

Rejoignez la BRED Banque Populaire : une banque coopérative conquérante, humaine et engagée

En tant que banque de proximité engagée sur ses territoires, nous soutenons activement le développement de nos territoires en Île-de-France, en Normandie et Outre-Mer avec un réseau de 411 implantations en France et à l'international, à travers nos filiales en Asie du Sud-Est, dans le Pacifique Sud, en Afrique et en Suisse.

Nos activités et nos expertises nous permettent d’accompagner durablement nos clients : banque de détail, banque de grandes entreprises et institutionnels, banque de gestion privée, banques à l’international, salle des marchés, société de gestion d’actifs, compagnie d’assurances, banque de financement du négoce international.

Conquérante, humaine et engagée, nos valeurs incarnent notre ambition de relever chaque jour de nouveaux défis et d’agir de manière responsable et durable afin d’accompagner nos 1,6 million de clients, 200 000 sociétaires ainsi que l'ensemble de nos collaborateurs.

Nous appartenons au Groupe BPCE - 2ème Groupe bancaire français.

Et Vous, si vous rejoigniez la BRED Banque Populaire ?

Forte de ses 7500 collaborateurs, dont 40 % sont basés en Outre-Mer et à l'international, la BRED Banque populaire vous propose un cadre professionnel épanouissant et des perspectives de carrière diversifiées, à l'échelle internationale.

Que vous soyez expert ou manager, vous intégrez une banque à taille humaine qui encourage la responsabilisation et la prise d’initiative et qui accorde une place importante au développement et à l’accompagnement de ses collaborateurs.

Poste et missions

Au sein du pôle Banque au Quotidien, Financements, Tarification et Règlementation, composé de 5 collaborateurs, vous interviendrez dans le développement, la promotion et le suivi de la gamme de produits Crédit immobilier et ADE à destination de la clientèle Particulier.

Concrètement vos principales missions seront les suivantes : 

 Analyser les attentes des clients Particuliers et les évolutions du marché (veille concurrentielle, réglementaire etc.) sur le domaine Crédit immobilier et ADE afin de détecter les tendances et nourrir la réflexion sur les évolutions produitParticiper à la création, au développement, à la mise en place et à l’évolution des produits Crédit immobilier et ADE à destination des clients Particuliers, gérés en agences, en lien avec les expertises internes ou du groupe BPCE,Assurer la mise en marché des nouveaux produits en coordination avec tous les services de la banque concernés (juridique/conformité/commercial), dans le respect de la réglementation et réaliser la communication interne auprès du réseau et externe auprès des clientsContribuer à l’élaboration du plan d’actions commercial annuel pour accompagner le développement du crédit immobilier et de l’ADE :Élaborer et piloter les plans d’actions marketing (lancements, campagnes, promotions).Définir les argumentaires, supports de communication et outils d’aide à la vente à destination du réseau commercial.Suivre et analyser la performance des actions menées (KPI, ROI, satisfaction client).Suivi de l’activité des produits du périmètre: nombre et montant, taux d’équipement…Assurer la gouvernance produits dans le cadre de la réglementation MIF II /DDA/PRIIPS: mise à jour de la documentation réglementaire et des outils de parcours conseil et reporting des ventesContribuer aux projets d’évolution des parcours clients dans les outils d'aide à la vente (parcours conseil/transactionnel) à destination des réseaux, espace client ou applications digitales, et réaliser des tests de recette - coordination des travaux en mode projet avec différentes équipes (Informatique, commercial, juridique, conformité, filiales…) dans le respect des engagements de délai et qualité. 
Profil et compétences requises

Vous êtes la candidate ou le candidat idéal(e) si :

De formation minimum BAC+4/5 en Développement commercial / Marketing, idéalement une expérience marketing, de préférence dans le secteur de la banque ou assurancesConnaissance des produits crédit immobilier et ADEDynamique, fiable et rigoureux, vous êtes organisé et doté d'un esprit d'analyse et de synthèse.Vous possédez une aisance relationnelle, faites preuve de curiosité ainsi que d'initiativeVous aimez travailler en mode projet, en équipe et en transverseVous disposez d'une bonne aisance rédactionnelle et maîtrisez les outils bureautiques.

Informations complémentaires sur le poste

Nous rejoindre ? C’est bénéficier des avantages liés à notre politique RH :

Un suivi de carrière personnalisé en lien avec votre manager et votre Responsable RH

Un dispositif de formations innovant : Ecole du Management BRED , des parcours individualisés ainsi que des plateformes d’autoformation.

Un package social attractif : 

Accord d’Intéressement / Participation attractif, basé sur la volonté de partage des résultats avec nos salariésAccord télétravail, 1 à 2 jours par semaine Accord sur la Qualité de Vie et des Conditions de TravailAutres avantages : Congés, RTT, Compte Epargne Temps, PEE/PERCO, mutuelle, prévoyance, retraite supplémentaire, surcomplémentaire santé, primes de crèche et de scolarité, CSE (subventions activités culture et loisirs…)

description.text:
About UsAt Chekin.com, we are redefining the guest check-in process with the most comprehensive automation software in the industry—from booking confirmation to check-out. As we scale rapidly across international markets, we're looking for talented professionals to join our collaborative, high-growth team.
Role:We’re hiring a full-time RevOps Specialist to help us transform data into insight, action, and automation. This role is ideal for a full-stack data professional passionate about enabling marketing, sales, and product teams with powerful data infrastructure, automation, and analytics.
You will design and own end-to-end marketing data pipelines, orchestrate RevOps automations using tools like Make.com, and support decision-making with clear and actionable dashboards.
Key ResponsibilitiesData Architecture: Build and scale data infrastructure across tools like BigQuery, PostgreSQL, Snowflake, ensuring reliable ingestion, modeling (e.g., dbt), and storage.Analytics & Insights: Define and calculate marketing/sales KPIs such as LTV/CAC, attribution, funnels, cohorts, and turn them into insights for growth and optimization.Dashboards: Design compelling visual dashboards in Looker Studio, Tableau, or Power BI for different teams—Marketing, Product, Finance.RevOps Automation: Use tools like Make.com, n8n, Python to automate CRM workflows, AI-powered lead scoring, and data sync across platforms (e.g., HubSpot, Facebook Ads).Web & Product Analytics: Implement and manage Google Analytics 4, including server-side tagging and real-time dashboards.Collaboration: Partner cross-functionally with Marketing, Sales, Product, and Legal to support rapid experiments and compliance (e.g., GDPR-ready data pipelines).
What We’re Looking ForTechnical SkillsStrong command of SQL, cloud databases (BigQuery preferred), and modern ELT tools (e.g., Fivetran, Airbyte)Familiar with dbt and modular data modelingExperience with HubSpot or similar CRM systems, including custom workflowsHands-on with Make.com, n8n, and optionally Python for AI-driven automationExperience with web analytics and marketing data across multiple channels
Soft SkillsClear communicator with the ability to tell a story with dataComfortable working in a remote-first, fast-paced startup environmentBias toward outcomes over tasks, fast iteration, and experimentationStrong problem-solving mindset and adaptability to ambiguity
Experience3+ years in a similar data or RevOps role, ideally in SaaS, B2B/B2C, or high-growth environmentsProven success in supporting marketing, sales, or product with data-led decisions and automations
EducationBachelor's or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or a related fieldFluent or professional English required (written and spoken)
Culture & Work EnvironmentWe are a fully remote company with a diverse, international team. Our culture is fast-moving, transparent, and impact-driven. You’ll work alongside creative professionals who value autonomy, ownership, and continuous learning.

description.text:
WeTransfer helps millions of users share ideas and collaborate seamlessly. Now part of Bending Spoons, it plays a key role in a portfolio of outstanding digital businesses united by a shared focus on innovation and operational excellence. By applying through the WeTransfer brand, you’ll be stepping into the wider Bending Spoons team. You may work directly on WeTransfer or contribute to one of our other leading products. Either way, you’ll be part of a high-performing, collaborative environment where you can make a real impact.

At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilitiesSpecialize. Learn everything about your product, its business model, and the key levers driving its growth.Analyze. Dive deep into the data of high-performance campaigns to find patterns that ensure their ongoing success.Ideate. Find new ways to optimize monetization and drive profitability, taking inspiration from experiments, winning approaches from other Bending Spoons products, and competitors.Experiment. Design and run A/B tests to validate your ideas with real users, collaborating closely with designers, engineers, and analysts to bring your experiments to life.Implement. If an idea proves successful, roll it out to all users. If it doesn’t, use the learnings to sharpen your intuition and fuel the next cycle of ideation and testing.

What we look forReasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.Drive. You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.

What we offerIncredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of £66,779 in the UK and €63,965 elsewhere. For a candidate that we assess as possessing considerable relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between £110,389 and £149,636 in the UK, and €105,737 and €143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

Commitment & contract
Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.

Location
Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.

The selection process
If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests designed to assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. They’re challenging and may take several hours to complete. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.

We set the bar high and won't extend an offer until we're convinced we've found the right candidate. This is why a job may stay open for months or be reposted several times.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and provide reasonable accommodations for an individual with disabilities—just let us know through this form.

Before you apply
If you’ve applied before but didn't receive an offer, we recommend waiting at least one year before applying again.

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment. We’re extremely ambitious and we hold ourselves—and one another—to a high standard. While this tends to lead to extraordinary learning, achievement, and career growth, it also requires significant commitment.

To help you ramp up quickly and set yourself up for success, we recommend spending your first few months working from our Milan office, regardless of your long-term work location. It’s the best way to rapidly absorb our company culture and build trust with your new teammates. We’ll support you with generous travel and accommodation assistance. After that, you’re welcome to work from our offices in Milan or London, or remotely from approved countries—depending on what we agree at the offer stage.

If the role speaks to you and you’re excited to give your best, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now—we can’t wait to meet you.

At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilitiesSpecialize. Learn everything about your product, its business model, and the key levers driving its growth.Analyze. Dive deep into the data of high-performance campaigns to find patterns that ensure their ongoing success.Ideate. Find new ways to optimize monetization and drive profitability, taking inspiration from experiments, winning approaches from other Bending Spoons products, and competitors.Experiment. Design and run A/B tests to validate your ideas with real users, collaborating closely with designers, engineers, and analysts to bring your experiments to life.Implement. If an idea proves successful, roll it out to all users. If it doesn’t, use the learnings to sharpen your intuition and fuel the next cycle of ideation and testing.

What we look forReasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.Drive. You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.

What we offerIncredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of £66,779 in the UK and €63,965 elsewhere. For a candidate that we assess as possessing considerable relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between £110,389 and £149,636 in the UK, and €105,737 and €143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

Commitment & contract
Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.

Location
Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.

The selection process
If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests designed to assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. They’re challenging and may take several hours to complete. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.

We set the bar high and won't extend an offer until we're convinced we've found the right candidate. This is why a job may stay open for months or be reposted several times.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and provide reasonable accommodations for an individual with disabilities—just let us know through this form.

Before you apply
If you’ve applied before but didn't receive an offer, we recommend waiting at least one year before applying again.

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment. We’re extremely ambitious and we hold ourselves—and one another—to a high standard. While this tends to lead to extraordinary learning, achievement, and career growth, it also requires significant commitment.

To help you ramp up quickly and set yourself up for success, we recommend spending your first few months working from our Milan office, regardless of your long-term work location. It’s the best way to rapidly absorb our company culture and build trust with your new teammates. We’ll support you with generous travel and accommodation assistance. After that, you’re welcome to work from our offices in Milan or London, or remotely from approved countries—depending on what we agree at the offer stage.

If the role speaks to you and you’re excited to give your best, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now—we can’t wait to meet you.

description.text:
Join Hostinger and we’ll grow fast! 🚀

Is there a limit to growth? Not at Hostinger.

We’re constantly reaching new heights. With a team of 900 professionals, we are behind the success of over 4 million clients in 150 countries, helping them launch their e-shops, blogs, portfolios, businesses, and passion projects.

Our mission: To build world-class solutions for anyone to easily succeed online

Our culture: Guided by  10 company principles 

Our formula for success: Customer obsession, innovative products, and talented teams.

Your role at Hostinger

Country manager in the international growth team. As part of Hostinger's international growth team, you'll be responsible for growing Hostinger’s market share in the France. You will focus on understanding target customers, evaluating channels, optimizing key metrics, and setting strategic country-level goals.

Curious to learn more? Connect with your team: Yaroslav Stepanenko, Head of International Growth

Your Day-to-day

Market Expansion & Investment Design and fully own the end-to-end go-to-market strategy for the France, ensuring incremental growth in market share across all efforts.Lead comprehensive market and channel analysis to identify key growth drivers and implement changes to increase market share.Own marketing budget allocation based on historical data, opportunity size, and strategic goals. Ensure a balance between:Immediate performance Long-term investments Tests & researches Align investments based on seasonality and local competition.Balance short-term tactical needs with long-term sustainable growth objectives.Business Development & PartnershipsUnlock high-impact partnerships with businesses, opinion leaders, and governmental entities to scale growth.Focus on strategic, high-value partnerships rather than executing small-scale tactical initiatives.Cross-Functional CollaborationWork with Marketing teams on channel-specific execution, ensuring alignment between global and country strategies.Provide localization direction to ensure brand messaging resonates in the market.Inform hiring roadmaps based on growth objectives and market-specific needs.Be the Primary VOC: Voice of Country, Voice of Customer & Voice of CompanyProvide critical market intelligence, trends, and cultural insights to drive key decisions on pricing, campaigns, and product development.Drive customer research initiatives to uncover hidden cohorts and untapped opportunities.Ensure Hostinger is perceived as a trusted brand in the market.Act as the voice and the face of the company in the local markets

Your Skills And Experience

Proven experience and a deep understanding of the France market.Skilled in analyzing customer needs, market trends, and the competitive landscape.Proficient in setting country-level goals, evaluating opportunities, and formulating market entry or expansion strategies.Experienced in managing budgets, optimizing LTV/CAC, ROAS, and ensuring profitability.Adept at identifying effective channels, driving revenue growth, and executing go-to-market strategies.Capable of overseeing execution, managing cross-functional teams, and ensuring operational efficiency.Experienced in building partnerships, collaborating with internal and external stakeholders, and managing contracts.Skilled in navigating market challenges, regulatory changes, and business uncertainties.Effective at presenting ideas, aligning teams, and advocating for business priorities.Proficient in leveraging analytics and insights to enhance business performance.

Benefits For You

🚀 360 Growth: We provide limitless learning opportunities: access to platforms like Reforge and Scribd, global conferences, feedback culture, digital libraries and industry-leading subscriptions. Advance your career with internal mobility and grow with a team eager to share knowledge and support your success.🎯 Freedom & Responsibility: Work on your terms, whether from the comfort of home or anywhere in the world. With a home office budget, you can elevate your workspace. Enjoy the flexibility to manage your schedule while bringing your ideas to life in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.💪Wellness Simplified: Your health comes first with company-provided sick days, 20 paid suspension days, and recharge leave. Participate in global sports challenges and simply enjoy the balance of a lifestyle that prioritizes wellness.🎉 Work Hard, Party Hard: Recognize hard work with company events like Town Hall, Meet the Client initiatives, team-building experiences, and workations. Celebrate life’s big moments with milestone gifts for weddings, new parenthood, and graduations.

Compensation

Gross salary 70000 to 90000 EUR/year (depending on your experience).

Get ready to take your personal and professional growth to new heights! Join Hostinger today and be part of our journey 🚀

Three. Two. Onboard

Three. Two. Onboard

description.text:
We provide the DevOps automation platform built to empower developers. From cloud infrastructure provisioning to production deployment, Qovery streamlines every step, enabling faster delivery, simplified workflows, and significant time savings.

🤩 Why is your role important?

As Qovery’s first Product Marketing Manager, you will lay the foundation for how our story is told to the world. You’ll shape the way we position ourselves in a crowded DevOps and cloud market, crafting messaging that cuts through the noise and resonates with both developers and business buyers. This role is pivotal in giving clarity to our narrative, enabling the sales team, and helping our users understand the real value of choosing Qovery.

🚀 What will your job look like

As our first Product Marketing Manager, you’ll be both strategist and builder. Your mission will be to:

Define positioning and messaging that makes Qovery’s value clear to developers, platform teams, and business stakeholders. Enable our sales team with the right tools (battlecards, one-pagers, pitch decks) to communicate our story with clarity and impact. Shape our go-to-market strategy for new features and product launches, ensuring we stand out in a crowded DevOps/CloudOps market. Collaborate with Product and Engineering to translate complex technology into simple, compelling narratives. Lead market research and competitive analysis to keep us ahead of industry trends and sharpen our differentiation. Support demand generation with content and campaigns that attract and educate prospects. Embody Qovery’s Culture: Collaborate in a caring, transparent, and innovative environment, building authentic relationships with customers and colleagues.

This is a role for someone who thrives in an early-stage environment: you’ll have freedom to experiment, influence strategy directly, and set the standards for Product Marketing at Qovery.

💡 About you

We’re looking for a Product Marketing Manager who is equal parts storyteller and strategist. Someone who can dive deep into our product, empathize with developers and platform teams, and translate technical complexity into messages that resonate.

Here’s What Will Help You Succeed

Experience in B2B SaaS — ideally in DevOps, Cloud, Platform Engineering, or a technical developer-focused product. A builder’s mindset — you’ve shaped Product Marketing in a growing company before, or you’re eager to take on that challenge for the first time. Strong communication skills — you can switch seamlessly between writing clear, concise copy and building narratives for executives, customers, and sales teams. Analytical and curious — you like to dig into customer insights, market research, and data to inform positioning and strategy. Collaborative by nature — you work well with Product, Engineering, Sales, and Marketing, and know how to bridge technical and commercial worlds. Hands-on and proactive — in a small team, you’re comfortable rolling up your sleeves and making things happen.

Most importantly, you share our values: ownership, transparency, and a developer-first mindset.

🎯 What You’ll Get at Qovery

Competitive Compensation.Comprehensive Benefits.Flexible Work Setup: Remote-first culture; work from anywhere with a reliable internet connection.Learning Opportunities: Professional development and growth supported from day one.Innovative Environment: Join a high-growth startup pushing boundaries in cloud technology.Authentic Culture: Collaborate with a team that values care, innovation, and customer success.

💥 Our Talent Acquisition Process

We’ve designed a streamlined process to ensure a great candidate experience. Typically, it takes 3-4 weeks:

Initial Call: Meet with Marie or Ludwig to discuss your experience, motivation, and career goals.Hiring Manager Interview: A 60-minute deep dive into your sales skills and collaboration experience.Workshop/Case Study PresentationFinal Round: Meet with a co-founder and leadership to discuss alignment with Qovery’s values and mission.Reference Checks: Validate performance, integrity, and alignment with our needs.

We’re committed to keeping you informed throughout the process, ensuring a smooth and transparent experience.

We are passionate about simplifying the complexities of cloud infrastructure for software development. We provide an Internal Developer Platform that streamlines the path to production, offering solutions like testing, ephemeral environments, and a focus on continuous software improvement.

As a growing company co-founded by experienced professionals, we are committed to innovation and excellence in the tech world.

We are passionate about simplifying the complexities of cloud infrastructure for software development. We provide an Internal Developer Platform that streamlines the path to production, offering solutions like testing, ephemeral environments, and a focus on continuous software improvement.

As a growing company co-founded by experienced professionals, we are committed to innovation and excellence in the tech world.

description.text:
Join Hostinger and we’ll grow fast! 🚀

Is there a limit to growth? Not at Hostinger.

We’re constantly reaching new heights. With a team of 900 professionals, we are behind the success of over 4 million clients in 150 countries, helping them launch their e-shops, blogs, portfolios, businesses, and passion projects.

Our mission: To build world-class solutions for anyone to easily succeed online

Our culture: Guided by 10 company principles

Our formula for success: Customer obsession, innovative products, and talented teams.

Your role at Hostinger

Country manager in the international growth team. As part of Hostinger's international growth team, you'll be responsible for growing Hostinger’s market share in the France. You will focus on understanding target customers, evaluating channels, optimizing key metrics, and setting strategic country-level goals.

Curious to learn more? Connect with your team: Yaroslav Stepanenko, Head of International Growth

Your day-to-day:


Market Expansion & Investment Design and fully own the end-to-end go-to-market strategy for the France, ensuring incremental growth in market share across all effortsLead comprehensive market and channel analysis to identify key growth drivers and implement changes to increase market shareOwn marketing budget allocation based on historical data, opportunity size, and strategic goals. Ensure a balance between:Immediate performance Long-term investments Tests & researches Align investments based on seasonality and local competitionBalance short-term tactical needs with long-term sustainable growth objectivesBusiness Development & PartnershipsUnlock high-impact partnerships with businesses, opinion leaders, and governmental entities to scale growthFocus on strategic, high-value partnerships rather than executing small-scale tactical initiativesCross-Functional CollaborationWork with Marketing teams on channel-specific execution, ensuring alignment between global and country strategiesProvide localization direction to ensure brand messaging resonates in the marketInform hiring roadmaps based on growth objectives and market-specific needsBe the Primary VOC: Voice of Country, Voice of Customer & Voice of CompanyProvide critical market intelligence, trends, and cultural insights to drive key decisions on pricing, campaigns, and product developmentDrive customer research initiatives to uncover hidden cohorts and untapped opportunitiesEnsure Hostinger is perceived as a trusted brand in the marketAct as the voice and the face of the company in the local markets




Your skills and experience:


Proven experience and a deep understanding of the France marketSkilled in analyzing customer needs, market trends, and the competitive landscapeProficient in setting country-level goals, evaluating opportunities, and formulating market entry or expansion strategiesExperienced in managing budgets, optimizing LTV/CAC, ROAS, and ensuring profitabilityAdept at identifying effective channels, driving revenue growth, and executing go-to-market strategiesCapable of overseeing execution, managing cross-functional teams, and ensuring operational efficiencyExperienced in building partnerships, collaborating with internal and external stakeholders, and managing contractsSkilled in navigating market challenges, regulatory changes, and business uncertaintiesEffective at presenting ideas, aligning teams, and advocating for business prioritiesProficient in leveraging analytics and insights to enhance business performance




Benefits for you:


🚀 360 Growth: We provide limitless learning opportunities: access to platforms like Reforge and Scribd, global conferences, feedback culture, digital libraries and industry-leading subscriptions. Advance your career with internal mobility and grow with a team eager to share knowledge and support your success🎯 Freedom & Responsibility: Work on your terms, whether from the comfort of home or anywhere in the world. With a home office budget, you can elevate your workspace. Enjoy the flexibility to manage your schedule while bringing your ideas to life in a fast-paced, dynamic environment💪Wellness Simplified: Your health comes first with company-provided sick days, 20 paid suspension days, and recharge leave. Participate in global sports challenges and simply enjoy the balance of a lifestyle that prioritizes wellness🎉 Work Hard, Party Hard: Recognize hard work with company events like Town Hall, Meet the Client initiatives, team-building experiences, and workations. Celebrate life’s big moments with milestone gifts for weddings, new parenthood, and graduations




Compensation:


Gross salary 70000 to 90000 EUR/year (depending on your experience)




Get ready to take your personal and professional growth to new heights! Join Hostinger today and be part of our journey 🚀

Three. Two. Onboard

description.text:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

The full-remote option is accepted only if you reside in a country where the company has a legal entity.

Team

Our Gaming team is made up of hybrid-casual, casual and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.

Joining our Live games team means collaborating with gaming industry experts on globally renowned, enduring games, while embracing exciting new entrepreneurial ventures. With over seven billion downloads worldwide and a portfolio of more than 10 resilient hybrid games generating more than $20m per year, we are the largest and most successful hybrid publisher in the world.

Voodoo is creating a small experimentation team with a big mission: find the next best way to entertain the world by taking our best hits to a new level.

You will be one of the first members in a team of six and you will participate in every aspect of development, from ideation to testing the casual games in the market.

Role

Build your team and ensure that your team reaches their goalsLead, inspire and motivate the teams working on the games, and maintain enthusiasm for the projectImprove continuously the internal process of game creationPush updates with gameplay, meta-features and monetisation AB tests at a high paceFollow and improve Voodoo’s management guidelines and onboarding processesManage your team’s HR in order to keep only A players and help them to growShare your knowledge company-wide and help others grow their skillsMonitor and improve game metrics Be involved in all aspects of game development: UI, UX, game design, technical

Profile

Strong analytical skills and are detail and data-orientedPassion for mobile gamesExcellent communication, organization, execution skillsGood game UX knowledge,Mobile F2P market experiences, track record with a successful mobile gameSpeak and write EnglishUnderstanding of game design

Benefits

Best in Class compensationOther benefits according to the country you reside.

description.text:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 60+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

At Revolut, we do Ops differently. Our hyper-talented operations experts don’t just keep things ticking over. They’re given the most complex, hard-to-solve problems in the business. Then they create elegant, scalable solutions that keep pace with our ambitious growth plans.

We're looking for a Lead Product Strategy & Operations Manager to help us solve the toughest problems in our global fintech. Someone to roll up their sleeves and dive into every area of our business to help millions of customers worldwide.

Watch this video from our team members about what goes into being a Strategy & Operations Manager at Revolut. If you want to gain unparalleled experience at a leading fintech company, let’s get in touch.

What You'll Be Doing

Optimising scalable processes to support operational efficiency in Western EuropeLeading and executing core infrastructure projectsExploring and defining project priorities for the teamSetting timelines to reach goals efficientlyIdentifying opportunities to improve existing featuresProposing new features to address customer needsManaging critical vendor relationships to ensure service qualityBuilding systems to track vendor performance metricsDeveloping strategic supply chain partnerships and negotiating commercial terms

What You'll Need

A 2:1 degree or higher in a relevant field5+ years of work experience in a fast-paced environmentProficiency in coding with SQL, Python, or RA solid track record of taking ownership and leading complex projects end to endAn analytical mindset to deconstruct complex problemsExperience working with data-driven solutionsA proactive mindset with a focus on delivering data-driven impactExperience in presenting to C-Suite executivesAn interest in the financial industryLeadership capabilities

Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.

 Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don’t use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment. Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.

We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it’s a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice
