description.text: Chief Technology Officer (CTO) | Full-Time | International Software CompanyWe are a trusted recruitment partner, committed to connecting world-class professionals with leading global organizations. On behalf of a well-established international software company, we are seeking a visionary and highly skilled Chief Technology Officer (CTO) to drive innovation and lead the company’s technology strategy. This is a full-time executive position offering a unique opportunity to shape the future of cutting-edge software solutions.About the RoleAs CTO, you will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of technology strategy, development, and innovation within the organization. You will play a pivotal role in aligning technology initiatives with business goals, building scalable systems, and ensuring the company remains at the forefront of industry advancements. The role requires a balance of technical expertise, leadership excellence, and strategic vision.Key ResponsibilitiesDefine and lead the company’s overall technology vision, strategy, and roadmap.Oversee the design, development, and delivery of software products, ensuring high performance, security, and scalability.Drive innovation by staying ahead of emerging technologies, tools, and industry best practices.Collaborate with executive leadership to align technology initiatives with business strategy and growth objectives.Lead, mentor, and scale high-performing engineering and technology teams across international locations.Establish best practices for software development, architecture, and DevOps processes.Manage budgets, resources, and vendor relationships to ensure efficient delivery of technology solutions.Ensure compliance with global data protection, cybersecurity, and regulatory standards.QualificationsBachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field (MBA is a plus).12+ years of progressive experience in software engineering and technology leadership.Proven track record as a CTO, VP of Engineering, or equivalent senior technology leadership role in an international software company.Strong expertise in software architecture, cloud infrastructure, and product development.Demonstrated ability to scale teams, systems, and processes in high-growth environments.Exceptional leadership, communication, and decision-making skills.Fluency in English is required; additional languages are an advantage.What’s OfferedExecutive leadership role with global impact in a leading international software company.Competitive compensation package, including performance-based incentives.Opportunity to drive innovation and shape technology strategy on a global scale.Collaborative leadership culture and strong organizational vision.Professional growth within a dynamic and fast-evolving industry.Apply NowIf you are a forward-thinking technology leader ready to make a lasting impact in the software industry, we encourage you to apply and join a company committed to innovation and excellence.

description.text:
Descriptif du poste

Publicis France recherche un Social Media Manager en CDI pour l'une de ses agences créatives.

En tant que social media, vous interviendrez sur un grand compte pour la production de contenus fil rouge & temps forts, sur les principales plateformes Social Media de notre client (+ de 2M followers cumulés).

Missions

En Tant Que Social Media Manager

Vous élaborez les recommandations de Stratégie éditoriale : prise de brief client, rédaction du brief créa, suivi de prod. jusqu’à la mise en ligne.Vous assurez le suivi & relationnel client et vous contribuez à la mise à jour quotidienne de notre calendrier de production édito. en fonction des A/R.Vous produisez des bilans pertinents sur la base des datas collectées. Vous organisez et vous consolidez les enseignements pour enrichir la stratégie. éditoriale de notre client.

Qualifications

Compétences recherchées

Expertise Social Media significative et validée.Vous savez rédiger et présenter des recommandations stratégiques et opérationnellesVous êtes créatif.ve, vous savez proposer et défendre vos idéesEn veille permanente sur les innovations digitales, marketing & communication et bien sûr plateformes et formats Social Media.

Ce que vous avez en plus 

L’autonomie et l‘efficacité de vos contributionsL’expression écrite et oral irréprochableLa relation client : la base !L’état d’esprit bienveillant, au service du collectifL’anglais courant

Informations complémentaires

Viva La Différence !

Cette philosophie de Publicis Groupe témoigne depuis toujours de notre engagement pour la diversité et de la conviction que nos talents sont notre plus grande richesse et notre meilleur atout.

Nous valorisons ainsi toutes les singularités, sans distinction d’âge, de sexe, de couleur de peau, d’origine sociale, de religion, ou d’orientation sexuelle… seules la compétence et l’énergie comptent ! Nous encourageons toutes les candidatures qualifiées et seront ravis d’accompagner tout au long du processus de recrutement, de manière personnalisée un.e candidat.e en situation de handicap qui en ferait la demande.

Publicis France est engagé pour l’égalité des chances et l’équité d’opportunités pour tous et toutes.

description.text:
SoSafe has the ambition to become the leading human risk management provider in Europe. Our award-winning awareness platform triggers behavioural change by providing effective and engaging training and simulations on cybersecurity and data protection. Cybercrime is predicted to cost the world $10.5 trillion annually by 2025 - we invite you to be part of the solution!

We are looking for a Customer Success Manager who will help us achieve measurable results and thus generate real impact with the customer. This is what drives you. And at the same time, you want to make the internet a bit safer—in one of the most exciting industries of digitalisation—by working as a team with highly driven software developers and ex-consultants? Then you should keep reading!

Your mission:

Join a fast-growing SaaS scale-up at the forefront of IT Security. As a Customer Success Manager, you won’t just be keeping customers happy - you’ll be driving real growth. In this role, you’ll own customer relationships, expand adoption of our cutting-edge solutions, lead upsell opportunities, and manage renewals. You’ll also play a key role in shaping the future of our product, using customer feedback and insights to help evolve our offering. If you're excited by impact, growth, and being a true partner to your customers, we’d love to meet you.

Here's how you'll make a difference:

Manage a book of around 60 accounts, varying in size and complexity,Build and nurture long-term relationships with customers through tailored engagement and success plans,Lead commercial conversations, including upsell opportunities and contract renewals, with confidence and professionalism,Act as a trusted advisor on cybersecurity awareness, helping customers embed best practices across their organisation,Planning and leading business reviews which could be conducted both virtually and onsite,Plan and implement targeted campaigns to drive security awareness, user engagement, and measurable ROI,Proactively guide customers toward success by anticipating needs, identifying risks, and driving product adoption,Represent the voice of the customer internally by providing actionable feedback to influence product development,Cultivate advocacy by turning satisfied customers into brand champions, securing testimonials and case study opportunities.

What makes you a great fit:

You’re customer-obsessed, with a strong focus on delivering measurable value and long-term success,You lead with empathy- understanding that success starts with people, and you're able to build trust-based relationships internally and externally,You're naturally curious, always asking questions to better understand your customers' goals and challenges,You bring 2+ years of hands-on experience in Customer Success or another customer-facing, revenue-focused role (Account Manager or Account Executive), ideally in a SaaS environment,You have a proven track record of managing a similarly sized Book of Business, with the ability to juggle multiple priorities and adapt to varying customer needs,You’re confident and credible in commercial conversations, including upsells, renewals, and value-based negotiations,You’re skilled at managing multiple stakeholders - internally and externally - across a range of customer sizes and complexity,You're resilient – comfortable in a dynamic environment and able to adapt to change quickly,Prior experience in a high-growth scale-up or start-up environment is a strong plus – you know how to adapt and move fast,You thrive in a collaborative team culture and actively contribute to shared learning and success,You're happy to travel :30% of the time for customer onsites and industry events,You communicate fluently in French and English, both verbally and in writing,You're based in Paris or within a reasonable commuting distance to our office in the 9th arr., as you'll be working closely with our local team.

What we offer*

Work/Life balance: Flexible hours, 33 vacation daysWellbeing and financial support: Access to Open Up, corporate discountsConnection & community: Virtual events, collaborative team activities, and opportunities for local meet-upsAnd the list goes on: Tech equipment, referral bonuses, dog-friendly HQPerks and benefits listed above are for full-time employees and may vary slightly by office location. These are just a sample — you'll learn more during the interview process.

About Us

At SoSafe, we’re on a mission to make the digital world safer by addressing the human factor in cybersecurity. As one of the fastest-growing security awareness scale-ups worldwide, we leverage behavioural science and data-driven learning to empower people against cyber threats. Our Human Risk Management approach helps organisations turn their employees into their strongest line of defence.

Backed by leading VCs like Highland Europe and Global Founders Capital, we’re rapidly expanding across the globe. We’re looking for team players who want to drive meaningful change in cybersecurity, take ownership of their work, and grow with us.

If you thrive in a vibrant, purpose-driven environment that values innovation, diversity, and collaboration, then this is the place for you!

basic_info.title: CDD _ Chef de projet e-commerce F/H

description.text:
Depuis quatre ans, Monoprix est présent sur les plateformes de livraison UberEats et Deliveroo. Cette activité connaît une forte croissance depuis son lancement et nous recrutons un ou une chef.fe de projet qui y sera dédié.e.

Au sein de la direction alimentaire et beauté et directement rattaché.e au Chef de Service Quick-Commerce, le ou la chef.fe de projet Quick-Commerce aura pour responsabilités de définir, déployer et piloter la stratégie d’offre, de promotion et de communication sur les plateformes Uber Eats et Deliveroo.

A ce poste, vous tisserez des liens avec un grand nombre d’interlocuteurs aussi bien internes à Monoprix (E-Commerce, Marketing, Bureau d’Achat et Magasin) qu’externes (partenaires Uber Eats et Deliveroo, représentants d’outils digitaux, …) et enfin managerez un stagiaire.

Vos Missions Seront Les Suivantes

 Stratégie d'Offre : 

Définition de la stratégie d’offre et construction du catalogue produits de l’activité en collaboration avec les équipes du Bureau d’Achat Monoprix et les équipes E-CommerceAnalyse des ventes, Optimisation & Extension de l’offre en continuAnimation (thèmes, promotions ciblées) et suivi de la mise en ligne du catalogue produit sur les applicationsAmélioration continue du e-merchandising et de l’arborescence du catalogueLancement et gestion de nouveaux concepts sur les applications : monop’ Beauty et Monoprix Cantine


Stratégie Marketing Et Commerciale

Construction et pilotage du budget marketing avec une vision ROIsteDéfinition du plan d’animation commerciale sur les plateformes (scénarisation des temps forts, sélection et négociation des activations marketing mises en place, gestion tactique des budgets promotionnels)Coordination des campagnes marketing avec les partenaires et les équipes Monoprix : Marketing, CRM et Magasins Animation en transverse des sujets marketing et offre auprès des équipes opérationnelles magasins 


 Suivi activité et Management

Suivi et pilotage de l’activité à 360° (performances commerciales, performances opérationnelles, suivi des indicateurs clés), rédaction de reportings partagés avec le COMEX MonoprixMaitrise des stratégies d’offre et de marketing de l’activité et présentation régulière à la Directrice Ecommerce alimentaireVeille concurrentielle (marché de la livraison à domicile au sens large, plus spécifique sur le marché du quick commerce)Management direct d’un ou une stagiaire


Cette liste n’est pas limitative et pourra être amenée à évoluer en fonction de l’activité et des projets

Profil De Candidat Recherché

Formation BAC+4/+5 en Ecole de Commerce ou d’Ingénieur Dynamique, structuré et rigoureux, vous savez prioriser les tâches et faire avancer les projets, grâce notamment à un bon relationnel et une vraie proactivité. Sensibilité pour les nouveaux business models digitaux, le web et l’innovation, ainsi que pour les activités à forte traction commerciale Une première expérience réussie en e-commerce est un plus Maîtrise du Pack Office

basic_info.title: Head of Marketing (EMEA, United Kingdom, Ireland)

description.text:
About The Role

About You

Moving at our pace brings a lot of change, complexity, and ambiguity—and a little bit of chaos. Shopifolk thrive on that and are comfortable being uncomfortable. That means Shopify is not the right place for everyone.

About Shopify

Opportunity is not evenly distributed. Shopify puts independence within reach for anyone with a dream to start a business. We propel entrepreneurs and enterprises to scale the heights of their potential. Since 2006, we’ve grown to over 8,300 employees and generated over $1 trillion in sales for millions of merchants in 175 countries.

This is life-defining work that directly impacts people’s lives as much as it transforms your own. This is putting the power of the few in the hands of the many. This is a future with more voices rather than fewer.

About The Role

We are searching for a marketing leader to drive our up-market growth across the Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EMEA) region. As the Head of Marketing, EMEA, you will lead marketing's contribution to our regional business goals.

This is a pivotal leadership role. You will sit on the EMEA Senior Leadership Team (SLT), serving as the voice of marketing and a key architect of our regional strategy. You will lead through a combination of direct team management and cross-functional influence to ensure Marketing exceeds its overall pipeline goals. Your mission is clear: build a world-class marketing function that delivers predictable, scalable pipeline and drives revenue.

What You'll Do

Set the Regional Strategy: As a member of the EMEA SLT, co-own the regional revenue targets and develop the overarching marketing strategy to drive market penetration and meet our growth goals.Lead & Develop Your Team: Directly lead, coach, and inspire a high-performing regional team focused on Account-Based Marketing (ABM) and local campaigns, fostering a culture of accountability and impact.Represent Marketing Results: Take accountability for total regional marketing performance. You'll do this by building exceptional partnerships with global functional teams—including Partner, Events, Brand, and Performance Marketing—to rally the cross-functional team behind EMEA’s strategic priorities.Immerse in the Data: Hunt for funnel insights to refine marketing strategies for distinct customer segments and countries. Conduct frequent analysis on program performance to scale efforts, ensure an efficient marketing mix, and achieve KPIs.AI Reflexivity: You lead the team from the front when it comes to pushing the boundaries of AI usage to drive efficiency and impact.Communicate & Influence: Communicate insights, learnings, results, and recommendations to stakeholders at all levels on a regular cadence, ensuring alignment and celebrating progress.Be the Voice of the Region: Translate our global brand campaigns into locally resonant "expressions" that connect with customers across EMEA, providing critical market feedback back into global teams.


What You'll Bring

A significant track record of B2B marketing leadership within the EMEA technology or SaaS sector, with a clear history of exceeding pipeline and revenue targets.Deep expertise in building demand generation engines, particularly with Account-Based Marketing (ABM) programs, working in close partnership with Sales and Partnerships groups.A tendency to lead from a position of being in the work, with the team, as a deep craft expert.A talent for building, coaching, and inspiring high-performing teams. You are a leader who develops leaders.An ability to thrive in chaos, resolve ambiguity, and be solutions-oriented. You have a proven ability to juggle multiple high-impact projects and rally teams behind solutions.Mastery of leading in a matrixed environment. You excel at driving results through both direct reports and high-leverage, cross-functional influence.Deeply proficient in modern marketing technology and data systems.


Before you apply, consider if you can:

Care deeply about what you do and about making commerce better for everyone.Excel by seeking professional and personal hypergrowth.Keep up with an unrelenting pace (the week, not the quarter).Be resilient and resourceful in the face of ambiguity and thrive on (rather than endure) change.Bring critical thought and opinion.Use AI tools reflexively as part of your fundamental workflow.Embrace differences and disagreement to get shit done and move forward.Work digital-first for your daily work.


About Shopify

Opportunity is not evenly distributed. Shopify puts independence within reach for anyone with a dream to start a business. We propel entrepreneurs and enterprises to scale the heights of their potential. Since 2006, we’ve grown to over 8,300 employees and generated over $1 trillion in sales for millions of merchants in 175 countries.

This is life-defining work that directly impacts people’s lives as much as it transforms your own. This is putting the power of the few in the hands of the many, is a future with more voices rather than fewer, and is creating more choices instead of an elite option.

About You

Moving at our pace brings a lot of change, complexity, and ambiguity—and a little bit of chaos. Shopifolk thrive on that and are comfortable being uncomfortable. That means Shopify is not the right place for everyone.

Before you apply, consider if you can:

Care deeply about what you do and about making commerce better for everyoneExcel by seeking professional and personal hypergrowthKeep up with an unrelenting pace (the week, not the quarter)Be resilient and resourceful in face of ambiguity and thrive on (rather than endure) changeBring critical thought and opinionUse AI tools reflexively as part of your fundamental workflowEmbrace differences and disagreement to get shit done and move forwardWork digital-first for your daily work

description.text:
At Matter Labs, we believe freedom drives progress and prosperity. We don’t see ourselves as a company, but as a team aligned around a single mission: to advance personal freedom for all (see ZK Credo).

To achieve this goal, we’re building zkSync — a credibly neutral, fully open source technology stack and network on top of Ethereum, which is owned and governed by its community. We use advanced cryptography called zero-knowledge proofs to scale Ethereum infinitely without compromising on security or decentralization. With a world-class team, a community of over 1M supporters across Twitter + Discord, and hundreds of millions $ in funding, we have abundant resources to accomplish the mission.

The Role

We are looking for a Product Marketing Manager to lead the product marketing function for Matter Labs by owning end-to-end GTM for ZKsync, covering messaging, competitive insights, sales enablement, and developer education. Produce technical content (white papers, tutorials, videos) and maintain a continuous feedback loop with pilots and the community. Establish and track key metrics to optimize campaigns and expand the ZKsync ecosystem.

What You Will Be Doing

Go-to-Market Strategy: Design and execute comprehensive GTM plans for ZKsync product and feature launches, covering messaging, outreach playbooks, developer education programs, and ecosystem partner coordination.Competitive & Market Insights: Conduct ongoing competitive analyses, market intelligence, and end-user research to inform product positioning, feature prioritization, and technical content strategy.Sales Enablement: Build and maintain up-to-date sales collateral: one-pagers, datasheets, verticalized slide decks (e.g., “Blockchain for Payments,” “Private Transactions for Institutions”), case studies, and competitor battle cards, so BD and sales teams can articulate value and close deals.Messaging & Positioning: Develop concise, differentiated product messaging tailored to each target segment (developers, enterprises, DeFi users), and ensure consistent technical messaging across all channels.Educational Resources: Lead creation of high-impact developer-focused content such as videos, tutorials, white papers, implementation guides, sample code repositories, and case studies that demonstrate ZKsync’s value proposition to technical decision-makers.Customer & Community Feedback Loop: Gather and synthesize insights from pilots, early adopters, and developer communities, then channel them back into product and marketing priorities.Metrics & Reporting: Define, track, and report on key metrics such as developer sign-ups, integrations, MQLs, conversion rates, documentation usage, on-chain activity, churn, and community growth to measure marketing impact and continuously optimize campaigns.

What We Look For In You

Technical Marketing ExcellenceProven ability to translate complex, unique features into clear value propositionsExperience creating technical documentation and developer education programsTrack record of successful Web3 or Web2 enterprise product launches and developer activationsTechnical UnderstandingSolid grasp of blockchain technologyAbility to understand and explain technical products to non-technical audiencesFamiliarity with Web3 development tools and frameworksCompetitive Analysis & PositioningStrong product marketing fundamentals and GTM strategy developmentAbility to identify and articulate competitive differentiationProficiency in benchmarking product capabilities against competing solutions.Data-driven approach to measuring engagement and content effectivenessCross-functional LeadershipStrong collaboration skills with engineering, product, marketing and communications teamsAbility to coordinate complex launches across multiple stakeholdersExperience working in fast-paced technical environmentsContent CreationDistill complex blockchain concepts into concise, audience-appropriate value statementsExcellence in creating technically-oriented marketing materials and documentationUse data, benchmarks, and real-world examples to reinforce credibility and impactAbility to develop compelling educational content and presentation materialsAgility & AdaptabilityPivot strategies and tactics based on early feedback or new informationMake clear decisions in ambiguous contexts, surfacing risks and contingency optionsRealign cross-functional plans under tight deadlines and changing requirements
Working at Matter Labs

At Matter Labs, you have the freedom to work how you want, when you want, and from where you want. All positions are 100% remote (with optional travel to team and/or industry events). We operate in lean and nimble teams, with no time tracking and minimum bureaucracy. We move fast. Only results matter. We will provide you with everything you need to learn, grow, and be productive.

Our results-only environment means anyone who believes in our mission can join us, regardless of background, sexual orientation, race, gender, and age. Both our team and community are made up of people from diverse backgrounds. That's why, out of politeness and respect, we refrain from opinions on politics, religion, or sex at the workplace.

We designed our culture around the tenants of freedom and ownership. This ethos will underpin our positive-sum community as we evolve toward full decentralization.

What We Offer

 Competitive compensation Equity and token package Premium coverage for health, dental and vision insurance 16 weeks of parental leave Flexible paid time off Company closure weeks 1-2x per year $2000 USD work equipment stipend $300 USD monthly co-working allowance Company offsites 1-2x per year $500 USD learning & development stipend 401k plan for US Employees

Don't meet every single requirement? That's ok. At Matter Labs, we think big with a long-term view and encourage you to apply even if you don't think you check every box in the job description.

If this role resonates with you, please apply now.

Read more about working at Matter Labs here.

Important: We are remote-first, operating in the timezones between UTC-5 (Latam and Atlantic Coast) to UTC+7 (South-East Asia).

Please click here for our applicant privacy notice.

To all recruitment agencies: Matter Labs does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Matter Labs employees, or any other organisation location. Matter Labs is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Read our full policy here.

Technical Marketing ExcellenceProven ability to translate complex, unique features into clear value propositionsExperience creating technical documentation and developer education programsTrack record of successful Web3 or Web2 enterprise product launches and developer activationsTechnical UnderstandingSolid grasp of blockchain technologyAbility to understand and explain technical products to non-technical audiencesFamiliarity with Web3 development tools and frameworksCompetitive Analysis & PositioningStrong product marketing fundamentals and GTM strategy developmentAbility to identify and articulate competitive differentiationProficiency in benchmarking product capabilities against competing solutions.Data-driven approach to measuring engagement and content effectivenessCross-functional LeadershipStrong collaboration skills with engineering, product, marketing and communications teamsAbility to coordinate complex launches across multiple stakeholdersExperience working in fast-paced technical environmentsContent CreationDistill complex blockchain concepts into concise, audience-appropriate value statementsExcellence in creating technically-oriented marketing materials and documentationUse data, benchmarks, and real-world examples to reinforce credibility and impactAbility to develop compelling educational content and presentation materialsAgility & AdaptabilityPivot strategies and tactics based on early feedback or new informationMake clear decisions in ambiguous contexts, surfacing risks and contingency optionsRealign cross-functional plans under tight deadlines and changing requirements
Working at Matter Labs

At Matter Labs, you have the freedom to work how you want, when you want, and from where you want. All positions are 100% remote (with optional travel to team and/or industry events). We operate in lean and nimble teams, with no time tracking and minimum bureaucracy. We move fast. Only results matter. We will provide you with everything you need to learn, grow, and be productive.

Our results-only environment means anyone who believes in our mission can join us, regardless of background, sexual orientation, race, gender, and age. Both our team and community are made up of people from diverse backgrounds. That's why, out of politeness and respect, we refrain from opinions on politics, religion, or sex at the workplace.

We designed our culture around the tenants of freedom and ownership. This ethos will underpin our positive-sum community as we evolve toward full decentralization.

What We Offer

 Competitive compensation Equity and token package Premium coverage for health, dental and vision insurance 16 weeks of parental leave Flexible paid time off Company closure weeks 1-2x per year $2000 USD work equipment stipend $300 USD monthly co-working allowance Company offsites 1-2x per year $500 USD learning & development stipend 401k plan for US Employees

Don't meet every single requirement? That's ok. At Matter Labs, we think big with a long-term view and encourage you to apply even if you don't think you check every box in the job description.

If this role resonates with you, please apply now.

Read more about working at Matter Labs here.

Important: We are remote-first, operating in the timezones between UTC-5 (Latam and Atlantic Coast) to UTC+7 (South-East Asia).

Please click here for our applicant privacy notice.

To all recruitment agencies: Matter Labs does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Matter Labs employees, or any other organisation location. Matter Labs is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Read our full policy here.

description.text:
Amex GBT is a place where colleagues find inspiration in travel as a force for good and – through their work – can make an impact on our industry. We’re here to help our colleagues achieve success and offer an inclusive and collaborative culture where your voice is valued.

Global Online Strategy and Maintenance Manager

The Global Online Strategy Manager provides insight and support for all online solutions to the account management team and Schneider Electric travel leaders to enable effective interface of online tools with enterprise associates, efficient implementation of new features & releases, and realization of savings goals.

Skills:

Strong Concur environment knowledge and expertiseStrong understanding of global travel online operations, suppliers, and systemsHighly developed Project & Change management skills.Strong analytical thinker combined with written and verbal communication skills.Proven experience relating to the creation and delivery of business process strategies for large global clients.Demonstrated ability to work successfully across cultures and regions and the ability to work with cross-functional teams and to influence both internally and externally.Confident approach to presentations, client & internal meetings.Strong PC knowledge including related PowerPoint/Excel/ Microsoft Project/Email skills. In depth understanding of drivers for customer satisfaction in the business travel industry.


The Global Online Strategy manager will:

Global Strategy & Project Manager:Responsible Global Online life cycle: innovative leader, strategic thinker with a focus on program optimizationsupport the client, client management and customer’s contacts on a day-to-day basisLead the SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC Global travel programResponsible for driving innovative travel strategy balancing operational efficiency with a high touch service for the traveller experience.Develop Global & regional online adoption targets and market strategies for an intuitive online booking experience: Train, Monitor program status and savingsDevelop strategy plans, leader for customer expansion, future markets or technology implementation.Handle multiple priorities and deliver to often tight timeframes.Lead SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC Travel expansion, foresee markets implementations, expansion and technical sites optimization & site maintenance.Ensure the business requirements are aligned with global strategic objectives of both Amex GBT/partner and SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC.Special projects management: e.g. support SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC with new acquisitions and strategy.Online site reviews – Technical support to improve adoption levels including additional `new` functionalitylarge maintenance projects:Amex GBT Pre-Release – Testing and Post Release - Site updatesConcur Pre-Release – Testing and Post Release - Site updatesCSAT/Verbatim: analysis, solutions, recommendations shared

Implementation & Deployment manager Interact and support client in special projects and day-to-day requests such as Policy Exception management, crisis managementSupports Client and Client Management team leveraging project management,Implementation & deployment of Manage the Online tool roll out according to the project plan.Lead Concur Travel implementation programming & expansion of Concur Travel in new markets. Collaborate with GBT partners/JVs to develop and deploy Concur Travel in new countriesLead implementation of new booking function (Booking.com/Sponsored Guest …)Lead integration of new technology (Digital messages//Connect Update/OneGBT…) Interface with SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC’s travel program key contacts and technology teams, Amex product stakeholders, and online suppliers to implement, Development and support web applicationsGlobal solutions planning, developing, testing, and deployment of Concur functionalities, GDS & Local specifics.Amex GBT internal project impacting Online: Creation, development and communication of joint project plansProvide continuing support into current, upcoming, or developing technologiesMaximize tool capabilities to support enterprise policy and supplier strategies and ongoing program goals.Support the implementation of the Amex approved technology solutions that improve service delivery and execution of travel management demands.Key linkage for all advisories and future planning with key partners in American express i.e. Consulting, Card/Payment and MeetingsContinuing analysis and insight into current, upcoming, or developing technologies and benefits of integration or exclusion from program as per the industry and/or American ExpressConcur/Sustainability



Global Online Site Administrator, Support and Maintenance ManagerGlobal Site administrator on the Concur online booking tool. Implements vendor (air, rental car, hotel, etc.) agreements and monitors compliance with reporting, tracking data, knowledge on opportunities/challenges with performances of goals, etc. Client Travel Policy – Maintain the master list of Client travel policies. Ensure that Operations is notified of any changes and updates to the policies in OBTAirline, Car, Rail, Ground and Hotel Contracts – Maintain the vendor contracts in OBT + maintain Policy Rules & Messages Hotel:Handle the administrative aspects of the Hotel RFP. Hotel Maintenance: Load in OBT Preferred Properties, Preferred chains, Hotel Rate caps, Hotel policy Rules, Hotel messages Hotel policy Rules updates (Currency fluctuation)Bi-weekly Hotel calls: overview, action plans & milestones.AIR:Preferred airlines OBT upload and maintenanceAir policy Rules updates (Currency fluctuation)Update: Airline safety ratingBi-weekly Air calls: overview, action plans & milestones.CAR:Preferred Car OBT upload and maintenanceCar policy Rules updates (Currency fluctuation)Client Issues2nd level Tech support: Issue resolution/Vendor escalations/Outage &/or Maintenance communicationResearch and respond to client issues. Or open Salesforce/SNAP tickets for the relevant dept to research. Key linkage with the travel team to secure access to all needed resources, products, services and support. Daily maintenance of the Concur Travel live sites (GBT/Concur updates, new functionality, enhancement)Second technical travel support- provide support to incoming requests/questions or concerns received from the customer, users, Travel GBT/TPN teamCreate/maintain Concur casesCreate/maintain Solution Suggestions in ConcurCollaborate w/ Concur for prioritizing SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC CasesTrack changes/updates/enhancement applied through SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC Market requirement documents (40) & Global SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC Concur documentCommunication maintenance:Elaboration and Maintenance Concur Profile GuidesElaboration and Maintenance Concur Travel Getting Started FAQ

Profile support:HR feed & profiles move from one country to another- manual action required in ConcurProfile synch issue at profile level or site levelConcur Profile master: TPN (Sabre Profile/GDS Profile synch) + GBT proprietary: Connect Profile & PE+ migration; 1GBT Standards & SBP (…)Transient GBT Profile share w/ M&E Concur US (BCD)Global Site administrator for Concur US M&E site held by BCD- Maintenance of US M&E/BCD sites.TEST/Bear V. & Never W. Profiles maintenance- SecuredSite Setup support & maintenance:Company Locations/monthlyRisk country/ monthlyTrainingConcur Travel Release/new featureCurrency conversion/fluctuation -Twice a yearConcur Travel sitesLead CIBT: maintenance of the Concur CIBT app: disconnect/Connect + CIBT messagesMessage creation & maintenance: Login Warning, Company Notes…

Location

France

The #TeamGBT Experience

Work and life: Find your happy medium at Amex GBT.

Flexible benefits are tailored to each country and start the day you do. These include health and welfare insurance plans, retirement programs, parental leave, adoption assistance, and wellbeing resources to support you and your immediate family.Travel perks: get a choice of deals each week from major travel providers on everything from flights to hotels to cruises and car rentals.Develop the skills you want when the time is right for you, with access to over 20,000 courses on our learning platform, leadership courses, and new job openings available to internal candidates first.We strive to champion Inclusion in every aspect of our business at Amex GBT. You can connect with colleagues through our global INclusion Groups, centered around common identities or initiatives, to discuss challenges, obstacles, achievements, and drive company awareness and action.And much more!


All applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to age, sex, gender (and characteristics related to sex and gender), pregnancy (and related medical conditions), race, color, citizenship, religion, disability, or any other class or characteristic protected by law.

Click Here for Additional Disclosures in Accordance with the LA County Fair Chance Ordinance.

Furthermore, we are committed to providing reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please let your recruiter know if you need an accommodation at any point during the hiring process. For details regarding how we protect your data, please consult the Amex GBT Recruitment Privacy Statement.

What if I don’t meet every requirement? If you’re passionate about our mission and believe you’d be a phenomenal addition to our team, don’t worry about “checking every box;" please apply anyway. You may be exactly the person we’re looking for!

description.text:
Beaute Privée est le n°1 des ventes privées dédiées à la beauté et au bien-être. Le site propose chaque jour, à plus de 10 millions de beauty addicts, une sélection de plus de 2000 marques de cosmétiques (parfums, soins, maquillage, capillaires…) ainsi que plus de 500 lieux d’exception dans toute la France… Le tout à des prix réduits pouvant aller jusqu’à -90%.

La mission de Beaute Privée ? Dénicher les dernières marques tendance et les temples de la beauté au meilleur prix toute l’année.

Ton ambition ? Faire partie des talents qui relèveront les défis de demain !

Le Groupe Showroomprivé lutte activement contre toutes les formes de discriminations, donne sa chance à tous les types de profils et place la compétence et la motivation au premier rang. Au quotidien, nous nous engageons à créer un environnement de travail inclusif.

Ta mission si tu l'acceptes...

En collaboration directe avec La CCO, tu auras la charge de faire croître les revenus et la rentabilité de ta catégorie (skin, hair, body care), en travaillant à la fois sur le développement de ton portefeuille existant et sur le recrutement de nouvelles marques, le tout accompagné d’une équipe de Key Account Managers et de sales analysts.

Développement Commercial

Concevoir, écrire, valider et déployer une stratégie de développement de son pôle : vision stratégique et opérationnelle à court, moyen et long terme pour faire croitre durablement son pôle (CA, Marge sur coûts variables, Parts de marché, Stocks, Image).Fidéliser : mener des plans d’actions complets pour faire grandir chacun des comptes (coécriture de business plan, négociation du planning de ventes et des offres associées, proposition d’innovations dans le partenariat, développement des services, gestion du relationnel…).Prospecter : Définir et exécuter des plans d’actions de recrutement des marques prospects.(Re)négociation des contrats clés (nouveaux et reconductions)Se faire identifier comme référent expert de ses catégories sur le marché et par tous ses comptes partenaires au travers des RDV business, des salons professionnels, de parution en presse spécialisée…Analyser la performance des ventes (écoulement, CA, marge, audience, conversion, qualité) pour identifier les axes d’amélioration des ventes futures.

Pilotage De L’équipe

Manager et faire monter en compétence les équipes sous sa responsabilité directe. Management de 2/3 Key Account Manager et 3 Sales analyst.Animer son équipe : donner du sens, inspirer, développer l’énergie positive et l’esprit de conquête de l’équipe, développer la cohésion, redescendre les informations clés, suivre les plans d’actions initiés. Notamment au travers de routines de 1to1 & points d’équipe bien préparés.Accompagner & coacher ses équipes dans les moments clés : intégrations, négociations & meetings importants, arbitrages, difficultés, …Piloter les performances individuelles des membres de l’équipe (résultats et productivité) et identifier les perspectives d’évolutions.Piloter la bonne gestion de bout en bout des ventes et des stocks par son équipe.

Représentation Interne Du Pôle

Représenter son pôle auprès des autres services (Marketing, Production, Opérations…) afin de permettre un bon développement de ses catégories.Reporter à la Direction Générale sur les résultats et les plans du pôle.Incarner l’ADN et les valeurs de Beauté Privée 

Ce qui fera la différence...

De formation supérieure (Bac+4/5) de type Université et/ou Ecole de Commerce, tu disposes d'un minimum de 7 ans d’expérience sur un poste avec un volet commercial et une solide connaissance de l'environnement e-commerce, de ses enjeux ainsi que du secteur de la Beauté.

Compétences avérées en prospection, relation client/fournisseur et négociation avec des interlocuteurs de haut niveau, tu es toujours à l’affut de nouvelles marques et êtes curieuxExcellentes compétences en communication et prise de décisionFaire preuve d’agilité pour résoudre les problèmes et trouver des solutionsExpérience dans un rôle de management d’équipe avec une approche axée sur les résultats et le développement professionnelUne expérience dans un rôle de direction des ventes, de préférence dans le secteur du e-commerce est un plusAppétence forte à la beauté, à l’innovation

A quoi s’attendre ?!

Nous mettons tout en œuvre pour garantir à nos collaborateurs un cadre de travail stimulant et épanouissant. Showroomprivé.com est certifiée Happy Trainees pour l’année 2024 !

Des équipes dynamiques et conviviales qui incarnent au quotidien nos quatre valeurs : confiance, solidarité, responsabilité, excellenceNotre ADN à tous les étages : une bonne dose de dynamisme et de pragmatisme, beaucoup de curiosité et d’ouverture d’esprit mais surtout l’envie de proposer toujours plus, de créer et d’innover !Des locaux refaits à neufLa possibilité de télétravailler 1 jour par semaineUne cantine Mona Lisa au siègeDes remises collaborateurs sur nos sites showromprive.com et beauteprivee.frUne Carte Swile pour les titres restaurantUn CSE qui offre de multiples avantagesUn Programme de cooptationDe nombreux évènements : matinées d’intégration, Showroom Story -Happy Hour pour célébrer les succès du groupe, conférences inspirantes, Session Q&A trimestrielle des dirigeants, etc.

Showroomprivé est un acteur majeur de la vente en ligne, un pionnier français du e-commerce. Les fondateurs Thierry Petit et David Dayan ont développé le Groupe à travers une vision forte et engagée. En proposant aux meilleures marques des solutions de ventes en ligne évènementielles, et autres solutions de visibilité et digitalisation, Showroomprivé leur permet de toucher une nouvelle clientèle désireuse de profiter des meilleurs prix

Showroomprivé est un acteur majeur de la vente en ligne, un pionnier français du e-commerce. Les fondateurs Thierry Petit et David Dayan ont développé le Groupe à travers une vision forte et engagée. En proposant aux meilleures marques des solutions de ventes en ligne évènementielles, et autres solutions de visibilité et digitalisation, Showroomprivé leur permet de toucher une nouvelle clientèle désireuse de profiter des meilleurs prix

description.text:
Title: French Speaking Product Marketing Manager – Digital Solutions Europe

Location: Remote within EU

Department: Marketing

Reports To: Product Marketing Director (based in Europe)

Functional Group: Digital Solutions

About FoodChain ID

FoodChain ID (www.foodchainid.com) is a global leader in food safety, quality, and sustainability solutions. Our Digital Solutions division helps agribusinesses, manufacturers, and retailers navigate regulatory complexity and unlock value through trusted, data-driven insights.

About The Role

We’re looking for a strategic and execution-focused Product Marketing Manager to support our Digital Solutions (Agricultural Solutions, Supplements, Packaging) portfolio across Europe, with a particular focus on French-speaking markets. You will drive product positioning, go-to-market strategies, and campaign execution for digital solutions focused on agricultural solutions, packaging and supplements.

This is a remote role within the EU and requires full professional fluency in French.

Key Responsibilities

Market Strategy & PositioningDefine the product positioning and messaging for digital solutions across European markets, with specific focus on French-speaking regionsIdentify local regulatory drivers and competitive dynamics to inform go-to-market approachesGo-to-Market ExecutionPlan and execute launches for new solutions in collaboration with commercial teamLocalize and adapt global messaging to resonate with regional and market-specific needsSales EnablementCreate localized sales tools: pitch decks, one-pagers, value propositions, objection-handling guidesDeliver training and support to regional sales and customer-facing teamsCampaign Support & Demand GenerationSupport campaign execution targeting ag input suppliers, distributors, and cooperatives across EuropeTrack campaign performance and support optimization based on engagement dataVoice of CustomerLead customer interviews and gather market insights to refine personas, positioning, and product roadmap inputsCross-functional CollaborationWork closely with Product, Sales, Regulatory, and the broader Marketing team to align priorities and initiatives
Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in marketing, or a related field (Master’s a plus)5+ years’ experience in B2B product marketing, preferably in agricultural solutions, packaging or supplementsNative or fluent French speaker; professional English requiredProven success in launching products and creating regional market demandExcellent communication skills and project management abilitiesExperience working in a matrixed, global environment

Nice to have

Experience with the following tools: SalesForce, PowerBI, Wordpress, ChatGPT

Performance Indicators

Pipeline generation across European marketsMarketing-sourced lead generation and conversionCampaign ROI and pipeline contributionMQL to Pipeline conversionEffectiveness of localized positioning and messaging

Note: This is a remote role with a preference for candidates based in France or neighboring EU countries. The ability to travel occasionally for team meetings or customer engagements is expected.

Powered by JazzHR

description.text: Êtes-vous prêt pour un nouveau défi ?  🚀 On recrute notre Account Manager e-commerce – CDI en full remote (2 jours/mois à Bordeaux)Vous êtes à l’aise en anglais, autonome, organisé(e), et vous aimez les environnements en croissance rapide ?Vous cherchez un poste stimulant, avec une vraie vision produit et une culture bienveillante?Bonne nouvelle : vous êtes peut-être à un clic de votre prochain job. 👇🌍 Qui sommes-nous?Depuis 2016, notre mission est claire : permettre à chacun d’acheter au prix juste.Comment ? Grâce à notre site web, notre app mobile et une extension navigateur intelligente, nous aidons plus de 2 millions d’utilisateurs à profiter des meilleures offres, cashback et codes promos en ligne.💡 100% autofinancés, rentables et indépendants, nous collaborons aujourd’hui avec plus de 3 000 partenaires e-commerce, en France et à l’international.Et ce n’est que le début.  Ce qu’on vous propose  🎯 Le poste : Account Manager (H/F)Rattaché(e) à notre équipe Sales, vous serez le moteur de la performance de vos partenaires e-commerce :Vous pilotez et développez votre portefeuille d’annonceurs (cashback, codes promos)Vous négociez des offres exclusives et co-construisez des plans marketing impactantsVous assurez leur visibilité multi-supports (site, app, extension)Vous activez et suivez les campagnes, en lien avec nos équipes Data & ProduitVous participez à l’acquisition de nouveaux partenairesVous créez des relations durables (visios, événements, calls réguliers, etc.)  Ce poste est fait pour vous si  🧠 Profil recherché:✅ Expérience réussie dans un univers digital (affiliation, cashback, régie pub, adtech ou agence)✅ Aisance avec la donnée et les KPIs – vous aimez les dashboards autant que les calls clients✅ Maîtrise de l’anglais à l’écrit et à l’oral✅ Esprit entrepreneurial, agile, force de proposition✅ Capacité à travailler en télétravail complet et en autonomie  Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?  Envie de rejoindre une équipe dynamique et passionnée ? On vous attend !🎁 Ce qu’on vous offre:🌐 100% télétravail (2 jours par mois à Bordeaux)💻 Enveloppe équipement remote : 300€🩺 Mutuelle prise en charge à 60%🕒 RTT📣 Un cadre de travail éthique, transparent, bienveillant🧪 Une culture de l’innovation et du test & learn💬 Des collègues curieux, sympas, et ambitieux  Pourquoi postuler avec Uptoo:  Uptoo est le 1er cabinet de recrutement spécialisé dans les commerciaux et managers commerciaux en France. Sur notre site Uptoo Jobs, vous trouverez en permanence plus de 1200 offres dans la vente, dans toutes les régions et tous les secteurs ! Référence: UPTN46602

basic_info.title: Chef de projet Marketing Généraliste H/F

description.text:
Fnac Darty, un leader européen de la distribution omnicanal.

Acteur omnicanal et européen, spécialisé dans la distribution de produits techniques et d'électroménager, de biens culturels et de loisirs, et leader du service après-vente présent dans 13 pays, avec 1010 magasins dans le monde, 11 millions d'abonnés/adhérents et 27 millions de visiteurs uniques cumulés par mois sur nos sites marchands.
Nos 25 000 collaborateurs sont notre meilleur atout. Ils font vivre la raison d'être du Groupe au quotidien, qui consiste à « s'engager pour un choix éclairé et une consommation durable », auprès de nos clients.

Fnac Darty recrute partout en France des talents aux profils, formations et expériences très diverses, que ce soit pour ses magasins, mais aussi dans les domaines de la logistique, de la réparation et service après-vente, de la livraison, de la relation client ou encore pour ses fonctions support. Votre prochain emploi vous attend chez Fnac Darty !
 
 Au sein de la Direction Marketing, le/la Chef(fe) de projet Marketing Généraliste joue un rôle clé dans la coordination, la priorisation et la mise en oeuvre des actions marketing en lien avec la Marketing Factory (équipes Print & Webdesign). Il/elle agit comme un point de contact central entre les équipes métiers, les partenaires internes et externes, et les équipes de production.

Missions principales :
- Arbitrage et priorisation des demandes
- Collaborer avec l'Animco et les équipes concernées pour arbitrer et prioriser les demandes adressées à la Marketing Factory.
- Évaluer la pertinence, l'impact et la faisabilité des demandes en fonction des ressources disponibles et des objectifs commerciaux.
- Cadrage des besoins
- Cadrer et challenger les besoins exprimés par les équipes émettrices (investissements, volume de supports, délais).
- Instruire les demandes internes afin d'évaluer leur niveau de priorité et les ressources nécessaires à leur réalisation.
- Coordination avec la Marketing Factory (Publicis)
- Briefer le Lead Marketing Factory sur les besoins identifiés afin de projeter le bon niveau de ressources
- Assurer le suivi du budget avec le Lead Marketing Factory
- Participation aux instances de pilotage
- Participer activement aux réunions hebdomadaires d'animation commerciale et aux points mensuels avec la Direction Commerciale.
- Gestion de la relation avec les partenaires externes
- Cadrer la relation commerciale avec les prestataires externes en lien avec les métiers Print & Webdesign.
- Garantir la qualité et la ponctualité des livrables produits par la Marketing Factory. 
 
 Profil recherché :

- Vous avez obligatoirement une expérience sur un même type de poste et environnement de 7 à 10 ans.
- Excellentes capacités de coordination, d'analyse et de priorisation.
- Aisance relationnelle et sens du travail en équipe.
- Connaissance des environnements Print & Webdesign appréciée.
- Capacité à évoluer dans un environnement dynamique et multi-interlocuteurs.
 Ref : 26420088

description.text:
Who You’ll Work With

Nike Energy Marketing drives connections with those that are culturally impacting today’s most discerning youth communities and puts forward new ideas to explore with them the intersections of sports and culture (fashion, music, art, design…).

As part of the Paris Energy team, you will work fluidly across the Paris/France Marketing Team, to foster strong relationships with cultural talents in the city/country. You will also work cross-functionally in the Paris office with key partners such as the Nike Brand Team and Sports Marketing in service of our athletes. You will work closely with the EMEA Energy Marketing Team and the Men’s/Women’s Consumer Construct (Marketing) teams in EHQ.

Who We Are Looking For

We are looking for a talented experienced marketing expert who is extremely well connected with Parisian youth cultural emerging scene and with a strong connection to fashion and a strong network with the community. An inventive marketing talent with an ability to imagine stories that can inspire the next generation to move, capable of considering his/her functions as a laboratory, find new strategic approaches as well as lead end-to-end project and keen to partner with crucial marketplace partners to turn their ideas into a reality on the ground.

A marketing talent willing to move forward in an experimental approach, capable of considering his/her functions as a laboratory, a testing ground to push the limits strategically, incubate, test and learn to imagine and build a new space for Nike and sport, when others do not see the looming opportunity. A collaborator with interest, open-mindedness and limitless passion, translating visionary language into something unique in its modernity.

What You’ll Work On

As the Lead Professional, Energy Marketing Runway, Paris/France, you will be a part of the Paris/France Marketing Team, reporting directly to the Director, Energy Marketing, Paris/France. This role will be responsible for balancing relationship management & marketing execution through our key talent relationships across the Paris cultural ecosystem.

Specifically, You Will Be Responsible For

Identifying and managing a network of cultural catalysts in Paris to boost the brand priorities and create the future of sport, in alignment to our global strategyProviding exceptional service and brand management to all talent relationshipsCreating visionary marketing concepts aimed at pushing the intersections of sports and culture through creativity with strong resonance among the youth in ParisLeading product collaborations projects with external partners & Global teamsFeeding relevant key catalyst relationships strategically into Geo & Global campaigns work to advance our position within our key sports territories Driving key Energy campaigns through pinnacle marketplace ecosystem in collaboration with our store partnersBriefing and managing external agencies Identify, gather and formulate structured insights about forward-thinking customers to enable us to better serve creative youth on the ground in Paris, and providing feedback to EMEA/Global teams to support long-term concepts 

All roles in our organisation will need to be agile to some extent. This will ensure that in an ever-changing landscape we always have enough resource to ensure pinnacle execution of our most key priorities.

WHAT DO YOU BRING TO NIKE?

A successful candidate will be expected to clearly demonstrate and articulate experience of the below essential requirements in order to be considered.

Essential Requirements

Solid experience in brand and/or brand functional management, with a strong focus on cross-functional marketing.Experience in cultural marketing in Paris and a demonstrable understanding of the visionary and forward-thinking customer, the city and Nike's position within it with credentials in strategic decision-making in this environment.Proven experience identifying, owning and managing external relationships with thought leaders in Paris - with a strong focus on fashion, aligned with Nike's strategic objectivesPrior marketing experience and a demonstrable understanding of the consumer, Paris and Nike’s position within it, with a track record of making strategic marketing decisions within this environment.A background and strong network within fashion and lifestyle is desirable.A desire and willingness to work in an agile fashion as neededProficiency in French and English

The closing date for this position is 1 September 2025. Relocation is not offered for this role.

basic_info.title: Assistant(e) marketing et Communication en Alternance

description.text:
Description du poste
Êtes-vous à la recherche d'une opportunité d'alternance dans le domaine du marketing et de la communication à TOULOUSE (31) ?
L'école Talia vous propose une formation diplômante reconnue par l'État en marketing et communication, vous permettant d'obtenir un Bac à Bac+5.
Nous sommes actuellement à la recherche d'un(e) alternant(e) pour occuper un poste polyvalent au sein de notre équipe marketing et communication. Vos missions consisteront à :
Participer à la conception et à la mise en œuvre de stratégies marketing ;Contribuer à l'élaboration de campagnes publicitaires et promotionnelles ;Analyser les données du marché pour identifier des opportunités ;Gérer les contenus sur les plateformes en ligne et les réseaux sociaux ;Collaborer avec les équipes internes pour assurer la cohérence de la communication.
Nous recherchons des personnes motivées, créatives, dotées d'un esprit analytique et ayant un intérêt marqué pour le domaine du marketing. Si vous êtes disponible immédiatement, cette opportunité est faite pour vous !
L'entreprise partenaire prendra en charge les frais de votre alternance, et vous serez rémunéré(e) pour votre travail sur place. Rejoignez notre équipe pour développer vos compétences dans le domaine du marketing et acquérir une expérience professionnelle solide.
N'attendez plus, postulez dès maintenant pour cette opportunité de formation et d'emploi en alternance !

basic_info.title: Chef de projet Marketing Généraliste F/H

description.text:
"Fnac Darty, un leader européen de la distribution omnicanal. Acteur omnicanal et européen, spécialisé dans la distribution de produits techniques et d'électroménager, de biens culturels et de loisirs, et leader du service après-vente présent dans 13 pays, avec 1005 magasins dans le monde, 11 millions d'abonnés/adhérents et 29 millions de visiteurs uniques cumulés par mois sur nos sites marchands. Nos 25 000 collaborateurs sont notre meilleur atout. Ils font vivre la raison d'être du Groupe au quotidien, qui consiste à « s'engager pour un choix éclairé et une consommation durable », auprès de nos clients. Fnac Darty recrute partout en France des talents aux profils, formations et expériences très diverses, que ce soit pour ses magasins, mais aussi dans les domaines de la logistique, de la réparation et service après-vente, de la livraison, de la relation client ou encore pour ses fonctions support. Chez Fnac Darty, nous recrutons sur les compétences, en accordant de l'attention à toutes les candidatures. Nous nous engageons à promouvoir la diversité, sans distinction d'origine, d'âge, de handicap, de genre ou d'orientation sexuelle, … dans un environnement respectueux de chaque personne. Votre prochain emploi vous attend chez Fnac Darty !",

Au sein de la Direction Marketing, le/la Chef(fe) de projet Marketing Généraliste joue un rôle clé dans la coordination, la priorisation et la mise en œuvre des actions marketing en lien avec la Marketing Factory (équipes Print & Webdesign). Il/elle agit comme un point de contact central entre les équipes métiers, les partenaires internes et externes, et les équipes de production.

Missions Principales

 Arbitrage et priorisation des demandes Collaborer avec l’Animco et les équipes concernées pour arbitrer et prioriser les demandes adressées à la Marketing Factory. Évaluer la pertinence, l’impact et la faisabilité des demandes en fonction des ressources disponibles et des objectifs commerciaux. Cadrage des besoins Cadrer et challenger les besoins exprimés par les équipes émettrices (investissements, volume de supports, délais). Instruire les demandes internes afin d’évaluer leur niveau de priorité et les ressources nécessaires à leur réalisation. Coordination avec la Marketing Factory (Publicis) Briefer le Lead Marketing Factory sur les besoins identifiés afin de projeter le bon niveau de ressources Assurer le suivi du budget avec le Lead Marketing Factory Participation aux instances de pilotage Participer activement aux réunions hebdomadaires d’animation commerciale et aux points mensuels avec la Direction Commerciale. Gestion de la relation avec les partenaires externes Cadrer la relation commerciale avec les prestataires externes en lien avec les métiers Print & Webdesign. Garantir la qualité et la ponctualité des livrables produits par la Marketing Factory.

Profil Recherché

 Excellentes capacités de coordination, d’analyse et de priorisation. Aisance relationnelle et sens du travail en équipe. Connaissance des environnements Print & Webdesign appréciée. Capacité à évoluer dans un environnement dynamique et multi-interlocuteurs.

Et une expérience sur un même type de poste et environnement de 7 à 10 ans.

description.text:
At Accelerant, we’re transforming the way capacity is distributed to specialist MGAs across Europe, UK, US and Canada. We help our partner MGA’s growth through high-quality capacity, strategic advice, streamlined processes, and exceptional service. We value innovation, collaboration, and a data-driven approach to create lasting success for our partners.
The RoleTo be successful in this role you will need significant experience of insurance and MGA operations/binder management. You also need to be a comfortable leader.
We are seeking a French-speaking Insurance Professional to join our growing team of experts. The Member Relationship Director lead MGA onboarding, relationship management, and operational delivery for our MGA Members across Europe. This is a high-impact role where you will be the key link between our Members, Brokers, Underwriters, and internal teams — ensuring exceptional service and strategic growth opportunities.
What You'll DoLead onboarding for new MGA Members, from due diligence to operational go-live.Manage relationships with existing MGA Members, ensuring ongoing satisfaction and growth.Identify strategic and tactical opportunities to support MGA Member success.Oversee and improve operational processes for greater efficiency.Ensure compliance with local and European regulatory standards.Act as an escalation point for operational issues, audits, and credit control matters.Coordinate with TPAs, Brokers, and Underwriters for smooth and timely information flow.
What You BringStrong knowledge and understanding of MGA operations and binder management.Experience in insuranceFluency in French and English (additional European languages are a plus).Proven experience managing MGA or delegated authority business relationships.Strong understanding of European insurance market regulations.Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.Self-starter mindset with the ability to work in a geographically diverse team.
Why Join UsBe part of a fast-growing, innovative company redefining delegated underwriting.Work alongside industry experts in an international, collaborative environment.Opportunity to shape and improve processes with measurable impact.Competitive compensation.
Enjoy our comprehensive benefits package designed to meet your diverse needs and support your well-being:
Work-life balance: We believe that taking time to rest and recharge makes us all better. That’s why we offer flexible time off and encourage our team to take the time they need to prioritize their health and well-being.
Health and wellness: We offer high-quality health, dental, and other benefits to ensureour team members have access to the care they need.
Remote work: Work where you’re most productive and fulfilled. This position is open to remote candidates across Europe who have the flexibility to work with our teams distributed across Europe and North America. Most cross-team collaboration happens in the mornings of the Eastern Time Zone.
Travel: We value face-to-face connections and believe that in-person interactions can enhance collaboration and build stronger relationships. Travel could be a small part of your role, with opportunities to connect with your team and our members in person.

About Accelerant:Accelerant is a data-driven risk exchange connecting underwriters of specialty insurance risk with risk capital providers. Accelerant was founded in 2018 by a group of longtime insurance industry executives and technology experts who shared a vision of rebuilding the way risk is exchanged – so that it works better, for everyone. The Accelerant risk exchange does business across more than 20 different countries and 250 specialty products, and we are proud that our insurers have been awarded an AM Best A- (Excellent) rating. For more information, please visit www.accelerant.ai
Ready to join us? Apply now and help us deliver exceptional service to our MGA Members across Europe.

description.text:
👏 Si tu veux faire le grand saut, bravo, tu es au bon endroit 👏

👯‍♀️ Le mot d'Elisa, notre superbe business developer, recrutée grâce à sa candidature spontanée : 

"J'ai envoyé ma candidature spontanée à SMADE parce que je trouve l'entreprise super intéressante et que y travailler me motive vraiment. C'est sympa d'avoir cette possibilité, surtout lorsque les postes proposées ne me correspondaient pas totalement. Tout au long du processus de recrutement, j’ai vraiment senti que mon profil était pris au sérieux, et cela montre à quel point SMADE valorise tous ses candidats, peu importe comment ils ont postulé."

En résumé, que tu sois... développeur·se, ingénieur·e dans l'électronique, la mécanique ou le software embarqué, data analyst, product owner, business (wo)man, qualiticien·ne, que tu veuilles travailler avec nos clients, avec nos fournisseurs, avec les SMADERS en général.

Tu es le.la bienvenue ici !

Et il faut surtout que tu sois... une personne passionné·e par son job et par la vie de startup, par l'innovation et les nouvelles technologies, par les nouveaux challenges, que tu aies envie de rejoindre un projet entrepreneurial et le monde de la Medtech (même si tu n'y connais rien aujourd'hui).

Tu peux candidater ici ou directement sur l'offre qui t'intéresse 😊

PS: dans le cas où nous n'avons pas d'offre à te proposer, nous conservons ta candidature afin de te recontacter si une opportunité se présente !

Rien n'est perdu, tente ta chance 😉 

💜 QUI SOMMES-NOUS ? 

Les SMADERS, ce sont une équipe de passionnés, engagés dans un projet fou pour lequel nous sommes les pionniers du marché ! Ce sont des basketteurs, des danseurs, des très bons cuistots, des chefs barbecue, des fans d'ABBA, de Céline Dion, de Rock, de Métal, des dog lovers, des globe-trotteurs, des humoristes en devenir 🤩

Les SMADERS sont des artistes dans leur domaine. Découvre-les en cliquant ici 👇

🤞LA PROMESSE SMADE 

Un cadre de travail flexible et orienté sur des projets innovants et challengeants. Une opportunité de faire partie des piliers d'une startup d'innovation Medtech qui va révolutionner le marché de l'orthopédie. La chance de travailler avec une équipe de passionnés, artistes dans leur expertise ✨

🤝 LE PROCESS

Dans le désordre, tu pourras rencontrer :

 Noémie ou Marion dans le cadre d'un échange de découverte RH et fit culturel (échange d'une heure en visio)Le Lead du département correspondant à ton expertise, et un·e pair·e technique dans le cadre d'un ou deux échanges techniques avec un exercice de réflexion sur un thème donné en amont (échanges d'une heure dans nos locaux) David (Team Lead) qui assistera à la restitution de l'exercice mais avec qui tu auras également l'occasion d'échanger en one-to-one dans le cadre d'un entretien de fit culturel (échange d'une heure en visio ou dans nos locaux)

companyResolutionResult.name: GoToFreedom Executive Search & Recruitment, Certified B Corporation

description.text:
Vous cherchez à rejoindre une structure entrepreneuriale en plein lancement ?Un grand cabinet européen de conseil lance un bureau à Paris. Vous participez à sa création, avec le soutien d’un groupe reconnu et l’autonomie d’un vrai entrepreneur. 
Vos missions: • Appui RCCI : cartographies des risques, procédures, comités.• Pilotage de projets de transformation : refonte de processus, contrôle, délégations.• Gestion de migrations d’actifs et projets de croissance.• Contribution à des projets réglementaires : audits ISR, conformité produits, statuts.• Implémentation d’outils IT : eFront, ERP, outils comptables.• Structuration des livrables, relation client, encadrement de profils juniors.
Votre Profil: • Expérience en conseil/projet dans la gestion d’actifs ou capital investissement.• Bonne maîtrise réglementaire, opérationnelle et IT.• Connaissance de eFront, SQL, Excel avancé (VBA = bonus).• Bilingue FR/EN, à l’aise avec métiers & techniques.• Autonome, rigoureux, esprit entrepreneurial.
Si vous êtes freelance, sentez-vous à l’aise de postuler ! 
Point de vue du consultant GOTOfreedom : • Rôle fondateur dans une structure en lancement.• Cadre stimulant, forte autonomie, impact direct.• Sécurité d’un grand groupe + agilité d’une petite équipe.

basic_info.title: Un ou une responsable de projets numériques

description.text:
Rejoignez notre équipe de Transformation Numérique en tant que Responsable de Projets Numériques! Vous serez chargé ou chargée de piloter des produits numériques innovants pour la formation professionnelle, la santé, le social et l'orientation. Votre mission : faire vivre l'excellence numérique au service des usagers!#TransformationNumérique #EmploiPublique #ResponsableDeProjets #Numérique #Innovation #RégionIDF
Vos Missions: (télétravail partiel possible)Piloter des produits numériques de A à Z (conception, déploiement, maintenance)Assurer la maîtrise d'ouvrage et la coordination transverse entre équipesGérer les ressources financières et contractuellesAnimer la transformation numérique de la Région et collaborer avec divers pôles et partenaires
Votre profil :Expert ou experte des enjeux numériques et des domaines ciblés (formation, santé, social, orientation)Connaissances des procédures de marché publicConnaissances des outils numériques et bureautiquesExpérience confirmée en management de projets numériques et travail en équipeCapacité à innover, négocier et prendre des initiatives
Pourquoi nous rejoindre?En intégrant la Région Île-de-France, vous rejoindrez un employeur de premier plan, innovant et engagé dans des projets d’envergure pour l’amélioration de la vie des Franciliens. Vous travaillerez au sein de l’écoquartier moderne des Docks de Saint-Ouen, à proximité de Paris, dans un cadre de travail dynamique, incluant télétravail, open-spaces, espaces de restauration variés, et bien plus encore.Nos atouts : Flexibilité, confiance, autonomie, et une culture collaborative sont au cœur de nos valeurs. Rejoignez une équipe passionnée et contribuez à des projets qui font la différence !
Vous souhaitez développer vos talents et partager nos challenges ? Découvrez nos autres opportunités de postes et postulez en ligne : www.iledefrance.fr/recrute Toutes nos offres sont handi-accessibles.
