description.text:
DIRECTOR OF INTERNATIONAL SALES – BASED IN EUROPE
On behalf of our client, Power Technologies, we are seeking a results-driven Director of International Sales to join their team in Europe (remote position). The ideal candidate can speak either German or French (or both), and will have a demonstrated ability to set up distribution, lead channel development initiatives, manage partner relationships, and drive revenue growth through effective sales execution and team collaboration.
COMPANY OVERVIEW
Power Technologies designs and markets high-quality products that support the smart charging, network management, and security of mobile digital devices. Mobile devices are continuously evolving and transforming the workflows and operating models of every industry. Our products enable organizations to deploy critical digital tools to their teams with confidence that the devices are ready for use, resulting in increased performance and productivity. At Power Technologies, we bring technology and connection to life. Company website: https://powertechnologies.com/
POSITION OVERVIEW
Reporting to the Chief Sales & Marketing Officer, who is based in the U.S, this role is responsible for managing and expanding our international sales operations across distribution, reseller, and end-user channels within the Education and Commercial sectors (including manufacturing, logistics, and healthcare).This position includes direct management of the international sales team, providing leadership, coaching, and performance oversight to ensure alignment with international sales objectives. The Director will coordinate regional sales strategies, monitor team KPIs, and foster a high-performance culture across geographically dispersed markets. In addition, the role will oversee partner enablement, deliver ongoing training, and ensure consistent execution of go-to-market plans.This position has a requirement of having direct experience in the EdTech market, working with distributors and resellers.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide day-to-day leadership and direction to international sales team members, setting clear priorities, coaching for performance, and fostering a culture of accountability and collaboration in alignment with international sales goals.Translate high-level business strategy into measurable goals and KPIs, ensuring alignment across team members, partners, and internal stakeholders.Develop and execute international sales strategies and tactical plans aligned with annual revenue and profit targets, to expand distribution, reseller, and end-user partnerships, with a strong emphasis on EdTech, ICT, and commercial markets.Manage the international sales and expense budget, tracking performance monthly and adjusting tactics to stay on target.Plan and conduct regular business reviews with distribution partners, ensuring alignment on product updates, brand strategy, marketing activities, and performance metrics.Collaborate with distribution leadership and sales reps to ensure effective lead capture, deal closure, and account management that supports market share growth.Design and implement regional sales and marketing plans, tailored to international markets, to increase visibility and penetration within value-added distributor networks.Ensure the sales team and channel partners are fully trained and equipped with product knowledge, application expertise, and the ability to effectively communicate value to customers and partners.Identify and drive cross-sell and upsell opportunities within the distribution channel to maximize revenue per account.Partner with marketing teams to co-develop impactful campaigns, track ROI, and apply insights to optimize future initiatives.Manage the end-to-end order process, including reviewing WSD purchase orders and coordinating with internal teams to ensure timely fulfillment and communication.Provide weekly report of pipeline, forecast, and activities within NetSuite CRM, including but not limited to sales-driven activities and communication associated with channel partners and end users, forecast, manage, and report on ongoing sales and pipeline activity.Leverage regional data and analytics to understand international customer behavior and refine sales strategies accordingly.Identify and communicate regularly with CSMO on new business and product opportunities within international education and commercial markets, contributing to product development and innovation.Deliver compelling product demonstrations and presentations, showcasing technical knowledge and market-specific benefits of the Power Technologies product line.Represent the company at international trade shows and exhibitions, supporting brand visibility and lead generation efforts.Support the creation of tailored sales tools and presentations, enabling partners to effectively position and sell Power Technologies solutions.Coordinate cross-functionally with internal departments (Marketing, Operations, Customer Service, Finance) to ensure seamless execution of sales initiatives and customer satisfaction.Participate in building and reinforcing company culture consistent with company purpose and values.Hold self and others accountable to conduct business in a manner compliant with Power Technologies’ policies and procedures and internal controls applicable to their role.Other duties as assigned.
CANDIDATE PROFILE:
The successful candidate will bring energy, initiative, and a collaborative mindset to the role. We are looking for a confident, competitive, and goal-oriented professional with a track record of building strong partnerships, managing remote teams, and delivering measurable results. This role requires a proactive approach to business development, with a focus on expanding global channel relationships and supporting the growth of the company’s product lines in international markets.
EXPERIENCE AND REQUIREMENTS
BA, BS degree is required.5+ years related sales or experience leading multi-person, multi-region international sales teams with demonstrated ability to navigate complex reseller and distributor organizations, build distribution through Warehouse Stocking Distributors and Resellers specifically within EdTech market is required.Excellent sales skills and sales leadership capabilities; exceptionally strong negotiation and consultation skillsAbility to deliver results against sales targets, with a proven record.Proven ability to engage in middle, senior, and C-level management structures.An articulate and effective communicator with demonstrated negotiation skills across multiple services and functions.Experienced in functioning effectively in an international environment.Ability to respond and work well under pressure and change.Proactive, highly organized, and detail-oriented with the ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively.Demonstrated ability to prioritize effectively, supporting multiple channel partners.Excellent presentation skillsStrong computer skills – specifically Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.CRM experience required; NetSuite experience is a bonus.Proficient in English and German, multilingual a plusAbility to travel up to 60% internationally.

description.text:
Qui sommes-nous ?
Motion Society propose aux créateurs de contenu une solution innovante pour optimiser la diffusion de leurs vidéos sur toutes les plateformes sociales. Notre mission est d'aider les créateurs à faire grandir leur audience grâce à une stratégie de contenu adaptée à chaque plateforme. En plein cœur de la creator economy, Motion Society est une start-up en pleine expansion, qui accompagne déjà plus de 250 créateurs ayant des millions d'abonnés.
Motion Society recherche un Customer Success Manager (création de poste) pour un CDD de 6 mois à compter de septembre 2025.
Ce que tu feras : 
En tant que Customer Success Manager, tu seras le point de contact principal pour nos créateurs. Ton rôle est de répondre avec précision, professionnalisme et bienveillance sur nos différents canaux, afin d'assurer une expérience claire, fluide et humaine à chaque étape de leur collaboration avec nous. 
Tes missions principales : 
Répondre aux messages des créateurs via e-mail, WhatsApp ou tout autre canal utilisé. Apporter des réponses claires, utiles et alignées avec notre ton (pro, simple, humain). Travailler main dans la main avec les équipes opérations pour traiter les demandes spécifiques, assurer une bonne circulation de l'information, et fournir des réponses précises et approfondies aux créateurs.Suivre les demandes en cours, relancer les interlocuteurs internes si besoin, et s'assurer que chaque créateur a les infos dont il a besoin.Créer une relation de confiance avec chaque créateur, en les aidant à se sentir écoutés, compris, et bien accompagnés.Être attentif.ve aux signaux faibles ou récurrents dans les échanges avec les créateurs, et alerter l’équipe opérations dès qu’un blocage ou une incompréhension nécessite une intervention rapide.Gérer la priorisation des demandes.Aider à améliorer la documentation (messages type, onboarding, process).
Ce qu'on cherche : 
Excellente communication écrite en français en anglais et espagnolTu sais adapter ton ton selon la personne en face (pro mais jamais froid).Tu es rigoureux.se, organisé.e et autonome.Tu as un très bon relationnelTu as déjà travaillé dans un rôle client / support / relation créateurs ou dans une startup (un plus).Tu es à l’aise avec des outils comme Slack, Notion, Gmail, Airtable, etc.Tu as une aisance pour la communication écrite
Ce qu’on t’offre : 
Un rôle clé dans une startup en pleine croissance.Une équipe humaine, réactive et orientée impact.Une vraie place pour ton avis, tes idées, et ton évolutionLa chance de travailler dans un environnement multiculturel et dynamique.
Comment postuler :
Pour rejoindre cette aventure passionnante avec Motion Society :Envoyez votre CV via Linkedin ou à l’adresse suivante : careers@motionsociety.io
Processus de recrutement : 
Premier entretien avec Laura, Talent Manager de 25 minutes en visio.Deuxième entretien avec Théo, Head of Operations et Justine, Distribution Manager en présentiel (comprenant un test écrit).
Visitez notre site www.motionsociety.com pour plus d'informations.
Rejoignez-nous chez Motion Society et participez à la redéfinition du paysage numérique pour les créateurs de contenu !

description.text:
About Us

SharkNinja is a global product design and technology company, with a diversified portfolio of 5-star rated lifestyle solutions that positively impact people’s lives in homes around the world. Powered by two trusted, global brands, Shark and Ninja, the company has a proven track record of bringing disruptive innovation to market, and developing one consumer product after another has allowed SharkNinja to enter multiple product categories, driving significant growth and market share gains. Headquartered in Needham, Massachusetts with more than 3,600+ associates, the company’s products are sold at key retailers, online and offline, and through distributors around the world.

Overview

The role will play a key part of our French Marketing Organization, focusing on Category Marketing in Country & Channel for our beauty brand. The Category Marketing function will be responsible for bringing our product to market, including channelization, product range planning /assortments, scenario planning, promotional calendar (in collaboration with Trade Marketing), in-market NPD launch plans, product positioning etc

What You'll Do

Be a local market expert: pro-actively communicate local nuances to plans, and provide updates on local competitorsProvide insights, context and narrative behind any suggested changes in countriesRange planning and local retailer strategy (channelization)Co-owner of sales out marketing plan, Co-ad budget, executional trade marketing planDelivers country reports to Regional for consolidationOwns in country execution and number

In More Details

GTM planningResponsible for Channelisation and Scenario planning ie big bets/risksResponsible for supporting local Sales & Trade Marketing teams with retailer sell in presentations and meetings including Product demonstrationsCountry retailer activation plans communication (Trade Marketing will own this however Category Marketing should report back to Regional once collated)GTM execution & monitoringResponsible for new product launches within local marketServe as a thought-leader in product launch alongside critical sales and brand marketing leaders – ensure that the “triad” of product, marketing, and sales execution comes together for every new launch.Support with the build of local joint business plans with retailersForecasting marketshare based on sell in/sell outProduct ranging and pricingResponsible for the Country Retailer assortments and SKUs assortment and channel strategy (by retailer) Co-Responsible with Trade Marketing for the Country Promotional Calendar and responsible for Pricing strategy – partnering closely with the Regional CP&A, Regional Marketing and Product DevelopmentNew product developmentProvide feedback on NPD inputs (consolidate Country insights / feedback and share with Regional)Product roadmap & assortment (including RRP)Responsible for channel strategy to achieve sales forecastResponsible for the Country Product Range & Roadmap locally from concept to shelfPartner closely with Regional Marketing and Product Development to bring roadmap to life.Oversee a rolling 6–24-month pipeline of new products within categories to launch within local market.Product testingProvides feedback on claimsConsult on product review and feeback (see consumer validation)Supports in-market testing for concept and packaging
What You'll Bring

Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business, communications, or a related field.Fluent French and English4+ years of experience in Marketing (brand or Trade), preferably in the Beauty industryDecisive and action oriented.Proven ability to work with multiple agencies and suppliersProven leadership and influencing abilities.Strong presentation, written and verbal communication skillsData analysis skills.Ability to use Microsoft applications.Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.Ability to think creatively and develop innovative solutions.Evidence of good attention to detail.Budget spendings tracking and managementEarger to learnAt ease in dynamic and agile environment

Our Culture

At SharkNinja, we don’t just raise the bar—we push past it every single day. Our Outrageously Extraordinary mindset drives us to tackle the impossible, push boundaries, and deliver results that others only dream of. If you thrive on breaking out of your swim lane, you’ll be right at home.

What We Offer

We offer competitive health insurance, retirement plans, paid time off, employee stock purchase options, wellness programs, SharkNinja product discounts, and more. We empower your personal and professional growth with high impact Learning Programs featuring bold voices redefining what’s possible. When you join, you’re not just part of a company—you’re part of an outrageously extraordinary community. Together, we won’t just launch products—we’ll disrupt entire markets.

At SharkNinja, Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion are vital to our global success. Valuing each unique voice and blending all of our diverse skills strengthens SharkNinja’s innovation every day. We support ALL associates in bringing their authentic selves to work, making an impact, and having the opportunity for career acceleration. With help from our leadership, associates, and our community, we aim to have equity be a key component of the SharkNinja DNA.

Learn More About Us

 Life At SharkNinja

Outrageously Extraordinary

SharkNinja's Candidate Privacy Notice can be found here: https://www.sharkninja.com/candidate-privacy-notice/

For candidates based in China, please visit: https://sharkninja.com/candidate-privacy-notice/china/

For candidates based in Vietnam, please visit: https://www.sharkninja.com/candidate-privacy-notice/vietnam/

We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability, or any other class protected by legislation, and local law. SharkNinja will consider reasonable accommodations consistent with legislation, and local law. If you require a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, please contact SharkNinja People & Culture at accommodations@sharkninja.com

description.text:
We are looking for a Partner / CEO to help develop our mission and grow the company.
B3Data is a digital construction startup building an online platform to create and update 3D BIM models and securely store building data with AI support. Our goal: make construction and property management more efficient, sustainable, and accessible.
What You'll DoShape vision, strategy, and partnerships in construction and smart citiesSupport product growth and adoption of our platformBuild relationships with stakeholders across the industryAdvance our social mission: workforce inclusion through digital innovation
Who We're Looking ForWe welcome everyone — from motivated students to experienced professionals. What matters most is your drive to innovate and collaborate.Experience in BIM, CAD, AI, data, or business development is valuable.
Why join?Be part of a mission-driven startupBuild the future of digital construction and smart citiesWork in a flexible, inclusive, and impact-oriented environment
Interested? Reach out at contact@b3data.com

basic_info.title: Full Cycle Account Executive (French and English Speaking)

description.text:
Hi there! Thanks for stopping by 👋

Are you actively looking for a new opportunity? Or just checking the market? Well… you might just be in the right place!

As a Full Cycle Account Executive focused on new business in the French region, you will play a pivotal role in driving revenue growth by identifying, engaging deals with high-value clients in the Hospitality industry. This role requires a proactive and results-driven sales professional with a proven track record of exceeding sales targets in a direct sales environment. Acting as a trusted advisor, you will understand the unique business challenges of potential clients and deliver tailored solutions that create impact and close deals effectively.

 Please note this role is based in Paris, France ***


What You’ll Be Doing

Prospecting and Identifying new business - primarily through telephone and email communication, and book demos of our software to prospective leads.Qualifying leads and assessing their needs to determine the best Lightspeed solution.Building and maintaining strong client relationships, ensuring exceptional customer service throughout the sales process and beyond.Negotiating terms and closing deals with potential clients.Collaborating with internal teams, including Marketing, Operations, and Product, to ensure a smooth experience for customers and to share market insights.Meeting and exceeding monthly, quarterly, and annual sales targets.Maintaining accurate records of sales activities and pipeline management.Staying up to date with industry trends and competitor offerings to identify new opportunities and optimize sales strategies.


What You Need To Bring

Outbound experience, cold calling, lead gen Ability to excel under pressure.Excellent communication skills in both, French and English.Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills.Excellent organizational and time-management abilities.Outstanding communication and relationship-building skills.Proven sales closure expertise.Strong listening and communication abilities.Persistence and resilience.Ability to handle objections effectively.Collaborative team spirit.


What’s in it for you?

Come live the Lightspeed experience...

Ability to do your job in a truly flexible environment;Unlock your potential with our growth program, paving the way for promotions and career advancement;Genuine career opportunities in a company that’s creating new jobs every day;Work in a team big enough for growth but lean enough to make a real impact.


… and enjoy a range of benefits that’ll keep you happy, healthy and (not) hungry:

Lightspeed share scheme (we are all owners)Health & Wellness Credit- expense up to 400 EUR per year towards your gym membership, yoga classes, a new bike or whatever else you do for your healthMental Health Support through the Modern Health App - whether it is meditation, coaching or counseling you need - each employee gets access to this platformPeople Experience - Our PX benefit allows you to work from pretty much anywhere in the world for 60 days a yearLinkedIn Learning: At Lightspeed we believe in having a growth mindset, we provide free access to LinkedIn learning along with your career GPS to help you learn & growTime off to volunteer and give back to your communityTransit benefit when you travel by public transportRegular breakfast or lunches, drinks & snacks in our Berlin office


#sales #accountexecutive #businessdevelopment

To all recruitment agencies: Lightspeed does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. If we have not directly engaged your company in writing to supply candidates for a specific vacancy, Lightspeed will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Lightspeed is a proud equal opportunity employer and we are committed to creating an inclusive and barrier-free workplace. Lightspeed welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Where to from here?

Obviously, this has to be mutually beneficial: we want you to step into a role you love, and we want to offer you a place you’re proud to come to every day. For a glimpse into our world check out our career page here.

Lightspeed is building communities through commerce, and we need people from all backgrounds and lived experiences to do that. We were founded in 2005, in Montreal’s gay village and our original members were all part of the LGBTQ+ community. The ethos of our business has been about inclusion from the very beginning, and we strive to provide a workplace where everyone belongs.

Who We Are

Powering the businesses that are the backbone of the global economy, Lightspeed's one-stop commerce platform helps merchants innovate to simplify, scale, and provide exceptional customer experiences. Our cloud commerce solution transforms and unifies online and physical operations, multichannel sales, expansion to new locations, global payments, financial solutions, and connection to supplier networks.

Founded in Montréal, Canada in 2005, Lightspeed is dual-listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: LSPD) and Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX: LSPD). With teams across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company serves retail, hospitality, and golf businesses in over 100 countries.

Lightspeed handles your information in accordance with our Applicant Privacy Statement.

description.text:
At Gurobi Optimization, we're on a mission! 

A mission that focuses on mathematical optimization. We empower our customers to expand their use of mathematical optimization technology in order to make smarter decisions and solve some of the world's toughest and most impactful business problems. We're looking for passionate, dedicated, innovative game-changers to join our team and drive the future of Gurobi.

As an Account Executive at Gurobi Optimization, your role will involve engaging and inspiring potential customers and expanding our existing client base in your assigned region. This includes managing both outbound prospecting efforts to uncover new opportunities and inbound leads requiring thoughtful follow-up. You will implement a land-and-expand strategy to grow revenue within existing accounts while identifying new buying centers and leveraging your technical B2B software sales expertise. Your advanced skills in building partnerships and fostering cross-functional engagement will be crucial.

Additionally, we will rely on your knowledge of the SaaS industry to drive engagement in markets beyond our optimization space. By presenting our solver in a user-friendly manner, you will captivate new audiences and generate demand across various industries.

What you will be doing?

Drive outbound sales strategies, including prospecting and account-based marketing, to penetrate high-value enterprise markets. Execute a robust land-and-expand strategy, increasing account value through upselling and cross-selling initiatives. Manage complex, multi-stakeholder sales cycles with technical and executive-level engagement, ensuring client alignment and satisfaction. Act as a trusted advisor, delivering tailored solutions that meet client objectives while maximizing account potential. Maintain and grow a robust pipeline, qualify opportunities effectively to prioritize high-impact accounts and ensure efficient resource allocation. Attend trade shows and company training events to expand outreach and increase brand visibility. Coordinate and collaborate cross-functionally across our global organization to ensure smooth operations and maximize sales opportunities. Keep the CRM system up-to-date with accurate and relevant information about clients and prospects. Provide management with well-informed forecasts and reports on sales progress and future opportunities. Stay informed about best practices, competitive threats, and developments in the optimization space to maintain a competitive edge. Document and track your progress in the CRM system to ensure transparency and accountability. 


What experience and qualifications should you have?

5+ years of experience in B2B SaaS sales or enterprise account management with a proven ability to exceed revenue targets. A Bachelor's degree in a business or communication-related or equivalent work experience. Technical and engineering education is a plus.  Proficiency in both written and spoken English. Additional language skills are a plus. 


What skills and abilities should you have?

Ability to identify and develop analytics to increase awareness of Gurobi's offerings in the assigned region. Proficiency in delivering presentations and training sessions effectively. Expertise in negotiation to secure favorable outcomes for Gurobi and its clients. Strong conflict resolution skills to protect the customer experience and enhance Gurobi's image. Ability to create compelling value propositions for partners. Proficiency in strategic and analytical thinking to assess decisions' internal and external impact. Aptitude for using data to plan and execute strategies effectively. Comfortable working with international teams in a cross-functional capacity. Satisfaction and ability to operate effectively from a home office in a remote work environment. Willingness to travel as required according to the specified level. Ability to participate in meetings across different time zones within reasonable expectations. Motivated ambition to achieve assigned Objective Key Results (OKRs). Commitment to upholding company policies and procedures. 


What other requirements should you have? 

Advanced-level technical B2B SaaS sales experience: Demonstrated expertise and success in selling B2B software solutions in a technical environment. Fluency with macOS, Microsoft 365, and Power BI: Proficiency in using these tools to effectively manage and analyze data, collaborate, and deliver presentations. Comfortable with learning and utilizing Salesforce: Ability to quickly learn and leverage Salesforce, a widely used customer relationship management (CRM) platform, to effectively manage sales activities and customer interactions. Comfortable working in an international setting and with a US-based company. Where applicable, a valid passport and the ability to obtain necessary international travel documents. 


Your Alignment with our Gurobi Core Values: 

Customer Focus: Verbal & written communication skills that bring clarity and build trust.  Power of the Team: Motivated with a team-oriented mindset that aims to both inspire and be inspired by others. Innovation: The courage to bring ideas forward and see yourself as an integral part of our global team.  Dedication: Organized and agile, focusing on meeting professional objectives while promoting a healthy work/life balance.  Integrity: Promise to uphold honesty as your compass and conduct all business practices with an ethical mindset and fiscal responsibility. 


Gurobi Optimization is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Gurobi Optimization is an E-Verify employer. As part of our hiring process, we utilize the federal E-Verify program to verify the employment eligibility of all newly hired employees. For additional information regarding E-Verify, please visit www.e-verify.gov.

basic_info.title: Expert Crédit Sénior et Mentor H/F - Team Full remote

description.text:
🎯 Nous rejoindre en tant qu'Expert Crédit Sénior et Mentor chez Pretto
L'entité Full-Remote de Pretto poursuit sa croissance rapide et pour accompagner cette dynamique, nous recherchons un(e) Expert Crédit Sénior / Mentor basé en France métropolitaine. Le poste mêle une forte contribution opérationnelle (4/5ème) et un temps dédié au mentorat d'une petite équipe junior (1/5ème). L'objectif affiché est d'évoluer sur un poste de Team Lead à moyen-terme mais il est aussi possible de rester sur un poste opérationnel. 
🌟Ton rôle
- Convertir un fort volume de flux entrant très qualifié via notre simulateur- Gérer un portefeuille et générer 25% de son chiffre d'affaires via le parrainage- Accompagner les clients dans la construction de la meilleure solution de financement dans le cadre de leur projet immobilier et savoir les fidéliser- Négocier avec les banques- Contribuer à l'amélioration continuelle de nos outils et technologies au contact d'une équipe Tech/Produit de folie- Accompagner la progression opérationnelle et suivre les performances de 1 à 3 Experts Crédits 
👫 Ton profil
- Tu as une expérience en Sales significative d'au moins 4/5 ans : tu te considères expert dans le développement commercial, idéalement sur du produit complexe- Si tu as de l'XP dans le courtage en crédit immo, ce sera bien évidemment un plus, mais ce n'est pas nécessairement un pré-requis !- Tu cherches une entreprise où il y a un fort volume d'activité à gérer, tu veux des journée qui filent à 100 à l'heure et beaucoup de clients à gérer en simultané !- Tu as une expérience significative en full-remote et tu sais maintenant que c'est comme ça que tu veux bosser (et pas autrement !)- Tu as déjà formé/mentoré/coaché des commerciaux apprenants et tu prends beaucoup de plaisir à le faire- Tu es avant tout drivé par une vraie soif de commerce : tu cherches à atteindre et dépasser des objectifs ambitieux- Tu cherches à devenir un manager engagé, qui inspire par l’exemple et crée un collectif soudé autour de lui- Tu es à l’aise avec les outils (CRM, solutions métier), et tu comprends que la tech est un levier fort de performance- Tu es rigoureux(se), structuré(e), avec un excellent relationnel et une communication irréprochable (écrite comme orale) 
🔥 Rejoins la team Sales parce que :
On t’offre un accompagnement en interne avec les meilleurs standards (formation coaching, culture de l’entraide et transmission de bonnes pratiques)On te propose un plan de carrière qui te permettra de grandir chez nousLa culture du feedback : chez Pretto tout le monde a droit de donner son avis et proposer des solutions, c'est même recommandé ! 
🎁 Les avantages à travailler chez Pretto
💰 Un package salarial avantageux : carte ticket restaurant Swile, mutuelle prise en charge à 50%🌟 Des primes attractives : vacances, cooptation pouvant aller jusqu'à 2000€, intéressement, naissance🍻 Des moments partagés entre collègues : onboarding avec ta promo, rituels d’équipe, offsite...💚 Prise en charge de 4 séances/an sur moka.care👥 Un parrain ou marraine référent(e) pour te permettre de t’intégrer et de t’épanouir chez Pretto
🤝 Notre processus de recrutement
Un entretien d'une heure en visio avec Charles ou Lorane - Team Talent AcquisitionPuis un entretien en visio avec Hélène, Head of Sales du bureau Full-remote, à la suite duquel nous te demanderons de nous communiquer une prise de référenceUn dernier échange en visio avec Pierre, CEO de PrettoFélicitations, nous te rappelons pour te faire une offre 🥳Bienvenue chez nous ! 🎉

basic_info.title: Head of Sales West and Southern Europe

description.text: Head of Sales, Europe West & SouthOur client is a fast-growing banking infrastructure provider that challenges the status quo in financial services. They empower businesses with the tools to move money efficiently and securely, and are now looking for a Head of Sales, Europe West & South to drive growth across France, Italy, Spain, Portugal, and other Mediterranean markets.Reporting to the EU Chief Executive Officer and Group Chief Revenue Officer, you will develop and execute the regional sales strategy, achieve revenue targets, and deliver new client wins. This is a fully remote role, though our client is specifically seeking someone based in France to establish strong local foundations for future growth.Key Responsibilities:Devise and secure senior management approval for a sales plan with targets and KPIs, positioning the company as a long-term partner to potential clients and creating momentum for change.Implement the approved sales plan to achieve short-, medium-, and long-term revenue growth, as well as other KPIs.Lead sales campaigns and manage the end-to-end sales cycle, including resource coordination, negotiation, and contract closing.Establish world-class sales processes (forecasting, pipeline management, account planning, etc.) to support growth in Europe West & South.Build senior-level relationships with clients, prospects, and partners to drive traction in the market.Develop and manage the partner ecosystem to enhance sales effectiveness in the region.Recommend pricing and sales strategies to leadership to maximise long-term value.Contribute to overall leadership, working closely with cross-functional teams to support existing clients and provide market feedback for product and service development.After initial success, build and lead a top-class sales team in Europe West & South, fostering a high-performance culture.What you’ll bring:B2B sales and client management experience in banking or fintech, including selling and managing high-value complex solutions with long sales cycles.Sales strategy expertise, with proven experience developing and executing plans to achieve revenue goals and KPIs.International experience, ideally across Europe.Language skills: Excellent English and French; fluency in Portuguese, Italian, or Spanish is a plus.Proactive attitude and leadership: takes initiative, collaborative, and able to unite teams.Energy and dynamism: creative, enthusiastic, action-oriented.Drive and ambition: motivated to exceed targets, challenge the status quo, and make an impact.Resourcefulness and flexibility: able to prioritise, work autonomously, and perform under pressure in a fast-changing environment.Personal qualities: organised, reliable, high integrity, detail-oriented, resilient, and open.

description.text:
About

Swan is Europe’s embedded banking specialist. We empower software companies to embed banking features like accounts, cards, and payments directly into their products, under their own brand.Swan processes over €1.5 billion in monthly transactions for more than 150 companies—like Pennylane, Indy, Agicap, Libeo, and Lucca. Founded in 2019, the company has received growth capital from leading investors such as Lakestar, Accel, Creandum, Bpifrance and Eight Roads. Swan is a principal member of Mastercard and a licensed financial institution, regulated by the French banking authority (ACPR).

Our mission

Banking belongs in business software

Many software companies already serve small businesses incredibly well: helping them send invoices, run payroll, manage inventory, and more. They’re on a mission to become the central hub for managing every aspect of business life.

But when it comes to financial workflows, there’s still a gap. Too many critical tasks like managing cash flow, tracking payments, or reconciling accounts happen outside the software, across spreadsheets, email threads, banking portals.

It’s a missed opportunity. Business software shouldn’t just record financial activity — it should run it.

To learn more about us: About Swan ; Our story.

Job Description

Swan is seeking a Senior Strategic Account Manager. Someone that will grow our business from the inside by ensuring the adoption, growth and success of our customers.

You will be in charge of managing and developing our portfolio of Swan’s customers in France (NB: we call them ‘partners’ at Swan). You will nurture relationships with them, help them market Swan’s offering, understand their priorities and roadmap to increase our adoption, and upsell them new features.

We are looking for a strategic thinker with strong business acumen who excels in identifying and capitalizing on entrepreneurial revenue opportunities. The ideal candidate should be curious, eager to learn, and possess a solid understanding of technical and regulatory concepts of a Financial Insitutution. They will leverage their consultative sales skills to understand partner and end-customer needs and position solutions for Swan's long-term success. As a collaborative team player, they will work closely with our Product and Compliance teams to integrate critical prospect and partner requirements into our roadmap and streamline our onboarding processes.

While we're expanding across Europe with local presence in multiple countries, this position is based on our headquarters is in Paris.

✨ Your mission

Ensure the success of our partners with Swan by:

Accelerating time-to-revenue during the onboarding phaseDriving planned revenue growthEnsuring a high level of satisfaction and avoiding churn

✨ Your responsibilities

Manage your portfolio of partners and be accountable for their revenue growth.Track and analyse your partners’ performance to identify opportunities and challengesConduct Quarterly Business Reviews (QBR) for top partners to track progress and align strategies, drive partner engagement with standardized monthly reporting and product marketingUpsell new features on existing projects with partnersMonitor and manage partner satisfaction through Health Score, CSAT, and other metricsCoordinate with the product development team to convey customer requirements and feedbackEffectively work cross-functionally across the organization to shape Swan’s solutions to meet customer needs

✨ Curious about your future team?

Within our Strategic Account Management team, you will part of our Operations department and work closely with Integration Specialists, Compliance, Account Executives and Support to ensure our the success and growth of our partners.

Preferred Experience

✨ You’re a great match if:

4+ years of experience in a business development or account management position in a start-up/scale-up, another fast-paced work environment or in a consulting firm.Master degree in a Tier-1 business or engineering schoolYou have a strong interest in startups and emerging technology businesses.You can understand and articulate technical concepts, translating them into business- or industry-relevant language.You are passionate about customer success and building long-term relationships.You are data-driven and highly analytical.You are fluent in French with professional proficiency in English.Our ideal teammate: Empathetic. Skilled. Frank. We love to challenge each other, and we leave our egos at the door.

It’s okay if you don’t tick all the boxes — don’t let imposter syndrome prevent you from applying! 🙌

Swan is committed to providing a caring work environment for all employees, regardless of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion, or belief.

When it comes to recruitment, we’re interested in your work experience, skills, and overall personality. Because diversity makes the workplace stronger and is necessary for Swan’s success, we are intensifying efforts to incorporate concrete actions to help us improve in this area.

About Swan

✨ Perks of being a Swanee:

Holidays : 25 days + RTT 🏝️Meal Vouchers: We provide a Swile card to cover your meals on work days. 🥗Transport: Monthly mobility package for employees. In accordance with the company agreement for sustainable mobilities, you can now use your mobility package to pay for alternative commuting modes. 🚇Health insurance (mutuelle): Alan. This is Swan's health and welfare insurance. 🚑Sports: Thanks to our partnership with Classpass and Gymlib, you can enjoy advantageous discounts on subscriptions. They offer a wide range of sports activities as well as wellness activities. 🏋Hybrid remote policy: We offer the possibility of working from home for 2 days per week. 🏡Offsite: Once a year we gather to reconnect, deep-dive into big topics, and relax. 🤝This isn’t a perk, it should be the rule, but diversity and inclusion are important at Swan. We’re working hard to get better every day.

✨ Our values:

Swan’s core values guide our actions daily. Individually, they may seem obvious, but together, they form a unique culture.

Simplicity: Leonardo Da Vinci said: “simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.” If something's convoluted or confusing, we work extra hard to break it down. - Making complex things simple is what we do.

Long Term: We always play the long game, whether it's to support our partners in their growth journey, or make tangible commitments to climate action.

Excellence: We are a team of experts who consistently go all out to create pixel-perfect banking services and exceed our partners' expectations— whatever it takes.

Be Human: We believe in the power of kindness and the importance of acting with integrity. But embracing our humanity extends beyond interpersonal interactions, it means caring about greater issues that affect our planet.

You can find out more about our culture.

Recruitment process

A 30-min video call with our Talent Acquisition Manager, to get to know you, understand your career expectations and answer your questionsAn interview with Lennig, our Team ManagerAn interview with Arthur, our Head of Strategic Account ManagementAn interview with Olivia, our COO

jobs_analyzed.description:
About

Swan is Europe’s embedded banking specialist. We empower software companies to embed banking features like accounts, cards, and payments directly into their products, under their own brand.Swan processes over €1.5 billion in monthly transactions for more than 150 companies—like Pennylane, Indy, Agicap, Libeo, and Lucca. Founded in 2019, the company has received growth capital from leading investors such as Lakestar, Accel, Creandum, Bpifrance and Eight Roads. Swan is a principal member of Mastercard and a licensed financial institution, regulated by the French banking authority (ACPR).

Our mission

Banking belongs in business software

Many software companies already serve small businesses incredibly well: helping them send invoices, run payroll, manage inventory, and more. They’re on a mission to become the central hub for managing every aspect of business life.

But when it comes to financial workflows, there’s still a gap. Too many critical tasks like managing cash flow, tracking payments, or reconciling accounts happen outside the software, across spreadsheets, email threads, banking portals.

It’s a missed opportunity. Business software shouldn’t just record financial activity — it should run it.

To learn more about us: About Swan ; Our story.

description.text:
Our client is a global leader in surgical innovation, focused on advancing technologies that improve outcomes for both patients and providers. They are seeking a Senior Regional Marketing Manager to drive downstream marketing strategy and execution across the region.
In this role, you will be responsible for developing marketing strategies, leading product launches, supporting field execution, and ensuring the commercial success of a highly technical product portfolio.
The position requires a balance of strategic thinking, hands-on execution, and cross-functional collaboration with sales, product management, and clinical teams.

Key responsibilities Develop and implement comprehensive downstream marketing strategies and tactics aligned to business objectives and commercial targets, based on market research and competitor analysisLead regional product launches in close collaboration with upstream product management, driving launch strategies, generating marketing materials, and executing commercialization programs including sales readiness trainingPartner with Marketing Communications to manage and enhance brand presence through marketing campaigns, convention strategy, and tailored collateral with clear product positioning and messagingProvide strategic and prioritized direction to the sales organization through marketing plans, training presentations, and ongoing communicationStay connected to customer needs and market trends by building relationships with KOLs, customers, and industry stakeholders to inform product launch plans and regional strategiesDevelop and deploy customer engagement programs, including advocacy initiatives, congress activities, and experience eventsCollaborate with cross-functional teams including sales, professional affairs, market development, and regulatory affairs to drive market expansion strategiesAct as a subject matter expert on the product portfolio, championing and communicating the value proposition internally and externallyEnsure marketing activities comply with industry regulations and company standardsTravel to customer sites to support clinical cases, training programs, and key industry eventsManage the departmental budget, ensuring efficient resource allocation
Key Requirements Minimum of five years of product marketing, clinical or marketing, or field sales experience within medical devices or capital equipment with highly technical productsProven experience in downstream marketing including scaled product launchesStrong ability to analyze market and financial data and translate insights into actionable strategyAbility to establish credibility quickly with customers, KOLs, and internal stakeholdersExcellent communication, presentation, and influencing skillsCustomer-focused mindset with a strong drive for resultsTrack record of working effectively in cross-functional and multidisciplinary teamsTravel across Europe ~20%
What Our Client OffersA mission-driven culture with a clear focus on improving surgical outcomesCollaborative colleagues who value teamwork and integrityThe chance to work on breakthrough technologies that directly impact patients’ livesOpportunities to develop your strengths, follow your passion, and advance your careerA flexible, engaging work environmentA competitive benefits package
If you’re interested in learning more please apply below!

description.text:
Qui sommes-nous ?

Nous sommes passionnés par les nouvelles technologies, et vous ?

Rejoindre Amiltone, c'est intégrer des équipes dynamiques et soudées dans le cadre de projets novateurs et ambitieux. Nous relevons les challenges techniques de nos clients et les accompagnons dans leur transformation digitale.

Pourquoi choisir Amiltone ?

Amiltone, plus qu'une entreprise, un état d'esprit !

Notre objectif ? Votre épanouissement professionnel !

Nous Avons à Cœur De

Vous accompagner au mieux au travers d'un suivi personnalisé

Vous faire monter en compétences en vous proposant des formations tout au long de votre carrière

Comprendre vos besoins et respecter nos engagements

Vous proposer des missions de qualité avec des technologies innovantes

Cultiver votre potentiel grâce à notre programme de développement personnel Addvise

Votre bien-être passe aussi par des activités extraprofessionnelles, c'est pourquoi nous vous proposons des séances sportives animées par nos coachs, soirées pour se retrouver et animations (à l'agence ou en visio), Gaming nights...

POSTE / MISSIONS

Le poste

Vos missions ?

En tant que chef de projet digital (H/F), vous serez en charge des missions suivantes:

 Gestion des équipes et des plannings Traduction des applications (anglais) Coordination des équipes Suivi et analyse des KPI Rédaction de spécifications fonctionnelles et des cahiers des charges

PROFIL RECHERCHÉ

Profil recherché

Alors ? Prêt à devenir Amiltonien ?

N'hésitez Pas à Postuler Si Vous Vous Reconnaissez

 Diplômé d'un Bac+5, vous disposez d'une première expérience en gestion de projet (stage ou alternance) Vous avez un niveau d'anglais courant (animation des réunions en anglais) Vous aimez le travail en équipe

Outre vos compétences techniques, nous nous intéressons également à votre potentiel, votre motivation ainsi qu'à votre personnalité.

Nos postes sont ouverts à des personnes en situation de handicap.

description.text:
We are looking to hire ambitious entrepreneurs to start and scale their own startups.
We are serial entrepreneurs, for example Paul Müller (founder Adjust, €1.2B exit) and Petter Made (founder SumUp, €8B) who are eager to support outlier personalities and serial entrepreneurs to build €1B+ companies.
We offer:

A salary while you build your startup as you will directly be employed by us. Alternatively, you can opt for up to €500k in funding.
Community: Access to the top 0.1% of founders, peers and investors
Personal Development: Weekly coaching with unicorn-founders
Funding: Support in securing a multi-million euro funding round within 12 months (on average, EWOR Fellows raise > €2M after our Grand Pitch)
Talent: Hiring support through our network (over 50,000 professionals)
Distribution: Support in reaching product-market-fit and building up a sales force / marketing machine

Highlighting just one of many success stories, one of our fellows set a record for Europe’s largest pre-seed round by a first-time founder, securing a €12M pre-seed investment.
Tasks

You will build, and run your own startup in fields such as Aerospace
You will embark on an extensive personal development journey crafted by unicorn founders and follow a fully customised programme enhancing your goal, time, and energy management
You will receive support in hiring through our network to over 50,000 professionals and advice as well as best practices from serial entrepreneurs
You will receive coaching in making your startup “investible”, i.e. ready to raise millions in funding
You will iterate your product with us until having reached product-market-fit and receive support in building up a sales force or creating a marketing empire respectively

Requirements

Based in Europe or the Americas or open to relocate
Willingness to take full responsibility for your own startup and scale it to €100M+ in revenues
Excellent communication skills and English language

Join us and build a €1B+ company with us!

description.text:
We’re seeking a results-driven Sportsbook Product Owner to work on a sports betting platform. You’ll work with partners, development teams, and internal stakeholders to deliver innovative, compliant, and high-performing sportsbook features that delight operators and their players.
Responsibilities
Own the sportsbook product roadmap and prioritise features for maximum commercial and user impact.Translate partner requirements into clear user stories and acceptance criteria.Manage end-to-end delivery of sportsbook features, from concept through launch.Oversee integrations with data feeds, trading tools, payments, and risk management systems.Ensure compliance with regulations across multiple jurisdictions.Monitor performance and gather feedback to improve the product.Stay ahead of sports betting trends and competitor offerings.
Requirements3+ years’ product experience in sportsbook or iGaming (B2B preferred).Strong knowledge of betting operations, markets, and integrations.Proven track record managing agile product backlogs.Understanding of compliance in regulated betting markets.Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.

basic_info.title: Global Sales & Marketing - EDG Sales - Associate or Vice President

description.text:
Job Description

Are you ready to take your career to the next level in the exciting world of Equity Derivatives Group (EDG) Sales? Join our dynamic team at J.P. Morgan, where your expertise and enthusiasm will fuel client engagement and drive growth in global markets. We offer exceptional opportunities for career advancement and a collaborative environment where you can thrive and make a meaningful impact.

As an Associate or Vice President in the EDG Sales team, you will play a key role in driving client engagement and expanding our market presence. You will work closely with clients to understand their needs and provide tailored solutions, leveraging our comprehensive suite of equity derivative products. Your role will involve collaborating with internal teams to deliver exceptional service and support, while contributing to the overall growth strategy of the business.

Job Responsibilities

Develop and maintain strong relationships with clients, understanding their needs and providing tailored solutions.Collaborate with internal teams to deliver exceptional service and support to clients.Drive client engagement and expand market presence through strategic initiatives.Provide market insights and analysis to clients, helping them make informed decisions.Assist in the development and execution of sales strategies to achieve business objectives.Monitor market trends and competitor activities to identify new opportunities.Ensure compliance with regulatory and legal requirements in all client interactions.

Required Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills

Proven experience in sales, preferably within the equity derivatives space or a related financial markets role.Strong understanding of equity derivative products and market dynamics.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain client relationships.Analytical mindset with the ability to provide market insights and analysis.Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.Proactive approach to problem-solving and ability to adapt to changing market conditions.

Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills

Experience working with global clients and understanding of international markets.Familiarity with regulatory requirements related to equity derivatives.Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Business, or a related field.

ABOUT US

J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world’s most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.

About The Team

J.P. Morgan’s Commercial & Investment Bank is a global leader across banking, markets, securities services and payments. Corporations, governments and institutions throughout the world entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. The Commercial & Investment Bank provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk and extends liquidity in markets around the world.

basic_info.title: Director of Marketing Intelligence & Research Integrity

description.text:
Location: Remote AnywhereReports to: Executive Director/CCODepartment: Executive Leadership – Research & Intelligence
Collectivus Holdings oversees the most prestigious brands in the Collecting, Trading Card Game, and Hobby industries. With a century of combined expertise in pioneering products, delivering exceptional quality, and enhancing customer experiences, Collectivus is synonymous with excellence. Our portfolio includes Beckett, Dragon Shield, Southern Hobby, and Merchant Guild— four brands with decades of expertise and dedication to elevating the collecting experience for enthusiasts and businesses alike.
About Us:Welcome to Merchant Guild, where passion meets purpose!We are a consulting and support agency dedicated to empowering the trading card game (TCG) and tabletop gaming industry.Our mission is not just to grow sales but to ignite the spirit of adventure within the hobby ecosystem, helping local game stores thrive.Through tailored strategies, market insights, and hands-on support, we equip retailers, distributors, and publishers to embrace the exciting future of gaming.Join us in shaping an industry where collaboration, creativity, and opportunity drive lasting success.
Role OverviewThe Director of Market Intelligence & Research Integrity is a senior executive responsible for setting the vision, strategy, and execution of Merchant Guild’s global research, analytics, data quality, and service pricing structure. This role merges the strategic foresight of market insight collected through the Retail Consultant network with the rigorous oversight of research integrity, while also driving the pricing strategy for Merchant Guild packages and pricing its services for maximum industry impact based on a strong insight into the global competitive landscape.
As the Guild’s top authority in market intelligence, this leader ensures that every data-driven product — from market reports to custom research engagements — delivers high-value insights built on uncompromising accuracy. At the same time, they develop and manage a pricing framework that aligns Merchant Guild’s offerings with industry demand, competitive positioning, and revenue objectives.
Key Responsibilities
Strategic LeadershipDefine and execute Merchant Guild’s research, analytics, and pricing strategy, ensuring alignment with long-term organizational goals.Collect information from the Retail Consultant to identify market trends, industry shifts, and competitive landscapes.Lead the production of flagship reports, market forecasts, and member intelligence briefings.
Market Insights & AnalyticsDirect the design of market research projects, including quantitative, qualitative, and hybrid methodologies.Oversee predictive analytics, scenario modelling, and competitive benchmarking.Ensure insights are effectively visualized, communicated, and actionable for varied audiences.
Research Quality & IntegrityEstablish and maintain rigorous quality assurance standards for all research outputs.Audit methodologies, validate data sources, and oversee peer review processes.Ensure compliance with ethical research practices and relevant data privacy laws (GDPR, CCPA).
Pricing Strategy & Commercial OversightDevelop and maintain a dynamic pricing framework for Merchant Guild’s research products, memberships, and consulting services.Conduct market-based pricing analysis to ensure competitive positioning while maximizing value and revenue.Collaborate with partnership managers to tailor pricing for custom projects, partnerships, and tiered service offerings.Monitor pricing performance and adjust strategies based on market feedback, demand trends, and profitability targets.
Qualifications8+ years in research operations, data governance, or analytics quality assurance.Strong track record in methodological design, data validation, and compliance.Strong understanding of pricing models, elasticity analysis, and value-based pricing approaches.Expertise in statistical techniques, sampling, and error mitigation.Familiarity with international data privacy laws (GDPR, CCPA) and ethical research practices.Exceptional attention to detail and commitment to accuracy.Proficiency with analytics tools and quality-checking processes.
Performance Metrics & Success Indicators
Research & Insights Delivery98%+ on-time delivery rate for research projects and reports.Zero critical accuracy errors in published research outputs.Stakeholder satisfaction scores of 8/10+ for relevance, clarity, and actionability of insights.
Data Quality & IntegrityAnnual methodology audit pass rate of 100% with no compliance breaches.Reduction in data discrepancies and errors year-over-year.Full compliance with GDPR, CCPA, and internal ethics standards.
Pricing & Revenue ImpactRevenue growth from research services of X% YoY (target set annually).Pricing model adoption rate across at least 90% of product/service lines.

#LI-Remote

description.text:
Logitech is the Sweet Spot for people who want their actions to have a positive global impact while having the flexibility to do it in their own way.

Location:

Logitech is proud to support a hybrid/remote work culture. This full-time role will be open to hybrid candidates based in or near San Jose, CA as well as remote candidates in other offsite US locations.

Team and Role Overview:

The Category Portfolio Manager will manage the comprehensive product lifecycle for the Gaming Accessory portfolio within the North American region. Partnering closely with sales, global teams, and supply chain to drive the achievement of key performance indicators ( revenue, margin, profitability, and market share).

Serving as a regional lead, the ideal candidate will bring passion and enthusiasm for driving product line growth amongst all channels with direct accountability for product/price positioning, demand planning, inventory optimization, market intelligence, go-to-market schedules, product line reviews, new product pitches to channel partners, and P&L management.

Your Contribution:

Be Yourself. Be Open. Stay Hungry and Humble. Collaborate. Challenge. Decide and just Do. Share our passion for Equality and the Environment.  These are the behaviors and values you’ll need for success at Logitech.

Key Responsibilities:

Serve as the product and category expert to secure and expand product assortments with retailers.Oversee product line management to ensure operational efficiency and adaptability to market dynamics.Develop and implement pricing and promotional strategies to drive market growth and share.Manage category product P&L and achieve defined business KPIs (pricing, promotional roadmap, standard margin).Align with internal Business Groups to ensure optimal product positioning for the NAM region, acting as the in-market product category expert.Manage demand forecasting and inventory, collaborating with sales operations and demand planning teams.Conduct market analysis, competitive reviews, and sales data analysis to proactively identify opportunities and risks.Execute comprehensive Product Life Cycle Management, including NPI planning, price modeling, forecasting, product setup, inventory management, and end-of-life management, in partnership with sales, supply chain, and planning teams.

Qualifications:

Exceptional quantitative skills for translating data into actionable business plans and profitable growth.Strong P&L/portfolio management and business analysis capabilities.Demonstrated ability to champion products and strategies both internally and externally.In-depth understanding of retail partners and channel strategy, particularly within consumer electronics.Excellent leadership, communication, and collaborative relationship-building skills.Fluency in English (verbal and written) is required.Superior communication and presentation skills to influence business, brand, and marketing strategy.Ability to work autonomously and collaboratively with diverse functional and geographical teams.Possess self-management skills and a proactive demeanor.Proven industry experience in consumer technology.

This position offers an OTE (On Target Earnings) of typically between $ 109K and $ 207K dependent on location and experience. In certain circumstances, higher compensation will be considered based on the business need, candidate experience, and skills.  

Across Logitech we empower collaboration and foster play. We help teams collaborate/learn from anywhere, without compromising on productivity or continuity so it should be no surprise that most of our jobs are open to work from home from most locations. Our hybrid work model allows some employees to work remotely while others work on-premises. Within this structure, you may have teams or departments split between working remotely and working in-house.

Logitech is an amazing place to work because it is full of authentic people who are inclusive by nature as well as by design. Being a global company, we value our diversity and celebrate all our differences. Don’t meet every single requirement? Not a problem. If you feel you are the right candidate for the opportunity, we strongly recommend that you apply. We want to meet you!

We offer comprehensive and competitive benefits packages and working environments that are designed to be flexible and help you to care for yourself and your loved ones, now and in the future. We believe that good health means more than getting medical care when you need it. Logitech supports a culture that encourages individuals to achieve good physical, financial, emotional, intellectual and social wellbeing so we all can create, achieve and enjoy more and support our families. We can’t wait to tell you more about them being that there are too many to list here and they vary based on location.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, age, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

If you require an accommodation to complete any part of the application process, are limited in the ability, are unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us toll free at +1-510-713-4866 for assistance and we will get back to you as soon as possible.

description.text:
We’re looking for a Casino Manager for a fast-growing iGaming business. 
You'll be at the heart of the product, evaluating new game titles, curating the best mix for players, and constantly refining the content strategy through data and player behavior. Whether it’s reviewing game mechanics, analyzing hit rates, or testing themes, you’ll help define what great looks like in the casino lobby.
This is a role for someone who lives and breathes casino content — someone who wants to build structured, scalable processes while staying close to the games that make players come back.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Reviewing upcoming games and assessing their potential fit for our playersUsing data to spot trends, player favorites, and untapped opportunitiesCreating repeatable systems for content launches, tagging, and localizationWorking with Product to ensure content and features go hand in handBuilding relationships with providers to secure standout titles and exclusives

description.text:
About White Hat GamingWhite Hat Gaming is a state-of-the-art iGaming platform providing a secure, scalable and flexible modular Casino and Sportsbook Player Account Management solution.
We offer operators choice, from our proprietary Player Account Management (PAM) to a full white-label solution. WHG provides market-leading content including Kambi Sportsbook, CRM tools, all payment options, and more than 3000 games from 120 leading games providers.
With over 500 talented colleagues from around the world, we offer a dynamic, collaborative environment where your ideas can flourish alongside industry leaders. Join us and be at the forefront of iGaming innovation!
In Summary:
We need a Product Owner to join our growing team and help us to continue delivering exceptional Casino experiences across a range of devices. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in compliance within the gaming industry, particularly in B2C or B2B2C environments and will form part of the Product Team at White Hat Gaming.
As a Product Owner in the compliance space, you will play a key role in enhancing our compliance products and integrations, ensuring that our platforms adhere to industry regulations and standards.
Your day to day:Leading an Agile team in delivering and enhancing compliance products and integrations.Working closely with the Scrum Master in establishing and developing frameworks, processes, and tools to build and improve the focus on Iterative Product DevelopmentContinually prioritising and enhancing the Product roadmap, as part of WHG’s Company RoadmapConstantly prioritising incoming work to balance various regulatory, stakeholder and technical inputsDocumenting stories and requirements clearly, concisely and appropriately Being an active part of a Scrum team, consisting of Product Owner, Scrum Master, Developers, QA and Integrations Engineers; preparing for and contributing fully in all scrum ceremonies to ensure effective delivery of the roadmap 
What we are looking for:In-depth knowledge of compliance within the gaming industry, with particular focus on KYC/Verification regulations across UK, Europe, Canada and the USA.Experience working with Casino operationsA collaborative approach and used to working with different Product VerticalsStrong analytical skills to interpret complex regulatory requirements and translate them into actionable product features4 years plus of compliance experience within iGaming, preferably in the B2C spaceAbility to translate company and business strategy into the WHG product visionAbility to identify and mitigate compliance risks associated with product development and implementationA value-focused product approach with a focus on enriching the productsDriving innovation, encouraging creativity, and collecting ideas for new propositions to strengthen and develop the product portfolio for the assigned product area whilst also adding business value as well as meeting the customers’ & market's needsAbility to translate B2C thinking, features and functionality into a packaged B2B offeringWorking together with other Product Owners, Product Managers and Head of Product to ensure alignment across various strategic dependenciesClearly communicate the product area strategies, roadmap, and planned deliveries to internal and external stakeholdersProvide insight to stakeholders and provide insights on key differentiatorsManage and own the profitability and commercial success of the designated product area
Nice to have:
Understanding of SDLC and, preferably, experience with provider integrationsKnowledge/experience of the Scrum frameworkExperience using Jira/Confluence and similar toolsFamiliarity with APIsProject or Product Management Certification (PMP, PSM or other)Experience and knowledge of Responsible Gambling regulations across UK, Europe, Canada, and the USA.
How we approach things:Dynamic Medium-Sized Environment: We have a can-do ethos, where innovation is encouraged, and action is valued.Core Values at Heart: We live by Teamwork, Innovation, Trust, and Integrity in everything we do.Results-Oriented Focus: We prioritize getting things done while supporting each other to reach both collective and individual goals.Open Collaboration: Our open-door policy fosters collaboration across all levels and departments, where ideas flow freely.Global Team: We are truly a global team with people from various counties and cultures contributing to our success.
What we offer:A remote and flexible working schedule. Generous time off varied based on the country of residence.Discretionary annual performance bonusTraining and other learning & development opportunities to support you through your career progression.Hardware & Software allowance or work equipment is provided to make sure you have all the right tools to get the job done.Various well-being programmes and initiatives.
Everything about WHG won't fit into a job ad, want to find out more about working with us? Apply to get the conversation started. 
We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, gender, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation, or age.
By submitting your application, you agree that we process your data in accordance with our Privacy Policy for the management of your candidature to any of the positions we offer.
